39455939.review:
ARKsys presents another entry in Guilty Gear universe created by Daisuke Ishiwatari. After gamechanger events of GG2:Overture series returned to 2D fighting game convention, and it did with style.
Story mode wasn't made traditionally, this time we have long animated cutscenes which take place after Arcade mode scenarios.
Arcade Mode mode contain cast of 17 character plus 3 DLC characters unlockable by in-game points or real money, including some newcomers : Bedman, Leo, Ramlethal and Elphelt. Every character is a perfect 3D sprite creating illusion of anime 2D silhouette. Fighting system is preety various, we can not only perform normal attacks and combos but also bursts and instant-kills, perfectly performed combo can even take out 100% of enemy health. Keyboard users can change keyset or even attack some combinations to one button making themselves equal to controller users.
M.O.M is a mode that let you fight characters with different skills, stats and also level up your character to unlock various items making him or her even more powerful.
Players can also test their skills in Mission mode, allowing us to train numerous combinations in arranged situations.
The Gallery is the place when we can buy color palettes, DLC characters, concept arts and music usable in online and versus modes, including those from previous GG games. 
Soundtrack from this one is not worse than in precedessors. My Favourite tracks are "Reunion", "Marionette", "Lilly of Steel" and "When life comes".
The only thing I do not like here are english voices, they just do not suit characters.

This one gave me many hours of fun so I will give it 9/10.

39001662.review:
+Fantastic art direction/art style
+Rockin OST
+There is an English dub for those who want it. Overall quality is hit or miss; there are issues with delivery, voice clip editing, audio balancing, etc. I find it worthy enough to be a positive 
+Very solid gameplay 

~The input buffer is slightly finicky; this is my opinion, and it’s listed here as an observation, and not a review point

-This game was played entirely on a keyboard, and using the button configuration menu was a hassle 
-The menus use their own fixed button configuration for navigation, and you can’t change it

-MOM mode is poorly executed, and ultimately is tedious and frustrating to play:
--There is a timer, which when empty, results in an automatic loss; this discourages defensive and cautious playstyles, and encourages you to be risky and aggressive
--Armor mode allows the computer opponent to attack with infinite super armor and unlockable supers. This mode is supposedly balanced by having the computer follow a set of rules, so the player has a chance to win. The problem is that the computer can break these rules whenever it wants to, and will do so
--Winning against multiple opponents in row results in a streak bonus. The idea is that the higher your streak bonus, the more challenging the next opponent is to beat. The issue is, that instead of having the next computer use more complex AI patterns, the game will instead increase stat numbers to the point where you cannot beat it
--The only way to compete against the increasing stats of your opponents is to level yourself up. It eventually becomes such a tediously long grind to so, that you end up wasted large amounts of time for little reward   

-Mission mode generally puts you in several instances with very little time to prepare yourself or react. I personally feel like it then judges your performance too harshly as a result; it gives you little leeway, and expects too much, especially if you’re a beginner

-Technical issue: “Guilty Until Proven Innocent” achievement has issues triggering 
(Going through arcade mode with a DLC character [Sin, Elphelt, or Leo] may be the root of the problem which causes this hiccup. I suggest avoiding them to trigger this achievement)

Story mode mini-review:
~It’s decent overall. 
-The production value is generally low, and a lot of waiting around and empty filler happens within the context of the story itself. 
+Seeing the how characters interact with each other is nice, and the main plot thread tying the story together is solid enough
~The most surprising thing to me, was that for a game praised for its great character animation during gameplay, I counted one scene that had animation of that same caliber
-There is no game to play in story mode; it is essentially an anime to watch

Bem,já da pra ter uma noção do game,considerando que joguei apenas 5 horas(até agora) eis aqui minha análise massa:
No começo eu achei que era só um game de luta simples em que o objetivo era quebrar todo mundo no soco,mas não é apenas isso,tem uma história CARALHAMENTE BEM FEITA nesse jogo,cara eu chorei nas primeiras horas com os flashbacks do Sol....E com a Elphet demonstrando seus sentimentos,cara que perfeito!
Sobre a gameplay e os gráficos:

O gráfico do jogo é o que mais chama a atenção,pois ele tem uma mistura de 2d e 3d,inclusive a arc system está usando essa engine no DB FIGHTERZ e eu GOSTEI MUITO! 
Bem,é isso o que eu tenho a dizer sobre esse game.

35781408.review:
Sadly, this is not a full Guilty Gear experience. And the future isn't promising either.
Guilty Gear XX Reload is a Fighter Masterpiece - but this version has less than half the original roster basically. Most of the iconic and beloved characters are missing.
Arc System releases full priced GG games on  (basically) an annual basis. Adding just a tiny pinch of the original XX Reload roster - we all been waiting for - every time - in order to make us wanting for more and leave room for future yearly releases and worse - DLCs.
Yes - they also release some of the #1 iconic franchise characters as paid DLC. Including Dizzy for instance. 

Sadly, at the current state of the games,  I can only recommend getting the latest game at a super-sale.

But in my opinion - it may be better to just wait several good years for Guilty Gear XRD to finally complete the roster.

The game could have been so much more:
The graphics here are simply incredible and spectacular. Best 3D visuals - mimicking 2D old school classic anime ever. 
The responsiveness is top notch. The gameplay is hardcore, lightning fast and powerful 
The music is amazing. Hard rock & heavy metal. Not as good as the older GGs - but definitely in the same spirit.
The animations are superb. 

This is still the successor to the world's #1 fighter. It's by far the  best 3D made into 2D fighter implementation I have ever seen.
The way they recreated the gameplay of the original 2D games from the days of old  is impeccable.

Which is why the lack of a full roster is a huge disappointment, that unfortunately has not been fixed yet in the next titles. The developers are squeezing and milking this franchise. There's no excuse here.

34065043.review:
I'm not good at it but it's still fun. I don't really know how to identify how these 2d anime fighting games can be considered as 'good' but for me it was good because the inputs are precise, the action is fast, the animations are amazing, it has a visual novel style story mode and a classic arcade style story mode, and has a progression mechanic(in-game store) where you can buy wallpapers, bgms, extra characters. I just think that this game has an overall package in and of itself, and that's me NOT having touched the online multiplayer yet, just local multiplayer.

P.S. I also would like to support Arc System Works because they make visually good and (based on what the FGC says) mechanically superior fighting games, and they now include PC versions.

33312402.review:
вот я собрался написать этот озор и даже не знаю с чего начать... Это Guilty Gear, двумерный файтинг с понастоящиму уникальными персонажами. Тут вам в распоряжении даётся чувак с пакетом на голове и гигантским скальпелем в руках, и одноглазый бландинчик раздающий люлей государственным флагом, девочка бросающая в вас дельфинов через кольца попутно давая по щам железным якорем, и чувак с идиотской причёской орудующий бильярдными шарами и даже подросток приковоный к ходячей кровати вооружённой циркулярными пилами. В общем вы поняли, дизайн персонажей крайне нелепый, однако это придаёт всей игровой серии уникальность, но проблема в том, что вся описанная мной трешовая дичь в плане персонажей наложена на весьма необычный сеттинг с путешествиями во времени, техногенными катастрофами и войнами с восставшим против человечества живым оружием в недалёком будущем с истоирей подаваемой на максимально серьёзных щах. Разработчики действительно хотят, чтобы я поверил созданный ими необычный мир с такими-то персонажами... Нельзя создать продуманную вселенную с глубоким бэкраундом, а потом просто напридумывать для него кучу максимально нелепых и бредовых персонажей, затем раскрутить между ними глобальный конфликт и надяться, что прокатит, это так не работает. 

Ну что что ж, о главной как мне кажтся проблеме игры поговорили, теперь поговорим о броблеме эстетического характера.  серия Guilty Gear никогда не славилась проработкой анимации персонажей. В играх этой серии движеия персонажей всегда были  рваные и неестественные и этот раз разумеется не стал исключением, хотя казалось бы движок Unreal 3 и трехмерные модели, можно было бы наконец избавиться этой проблемы и сделать по настоящему качетсвенную анимацию, но нет, разрабы и в этот раз решили остаться верными себе сделать анимацию через жопу, чтобы она выглядела как говно, но при этом сами персонажи нарисованы очень неплохо, детализация на уровне, селшединг придаёт игровому стилю особое очарование

ну а теперь пора поговорить про геймплей, а он тут действительно заслуживает внимания. В игре помимо стандартного аркадного режима есть режим М.О.М, суть которого заключается в последовательных боях с противниками различной сложности, выбиванием из них внутриигровой валюты, которую можно потрать на открытие контна из галереии. Сами бои проходят с врагами с неполным лайфбаром, который надо опустить до нуля до пяти раз за одну жизнь, поскольку поединки не делятся на раунды и после порожения вас возращает на экран выбора битвы. с каждой победой открываются более сложные поединки, а из повеженных компьтерных балванчиков выпадают сунду, которые надо разбивать пока бой не закончится. Из этих сундуков выпадают внутриигровая валюта, ключи к другим сундукам, и очки стихий, которые необходимы для использования способнотей помогающих в бою. Этот режим мне показался наиболее интересным из всего, что предоставляет игра, ибо сюжет нормально воспринимать никак не получается, а аркаждные бои быстро наскучили. Порог вхождения у данной игры значительно выше, чем у конкурентов, вертеть моногоударовые комбухи здесь по настоящему непросто, а уж неслучайно провести суперудар и подавно есть даже спциальные атаки снимающие весь лайфбар противника складываемый из специальной комбинации кнопок для кажого персонажа. Если проводить такие суперудары вплотную к сопернику, то заблокировать или уклониться не выйдет никак, что делает боевую систему не такой глубокой как хотелось бы. 

Подводя итог хотелось бы сказать, что я не знаю стоит или мне рекомендовать эту игру. Если вы любите Guilty Gear и вас не смущают нелепые персонажи с историями серьёзных щах, а так же рваная анимаия, то вы скорее всего уже купили эту игру или скачали с торрентов. Ну а если же вы как и я являетесь мимокродоилом данной серии и вам не по душе выше описанные проблемы, то лучше всё таки воздержаться от покупки

33298220.review:
Aún recuerdo aquel año 2014, en el cual los trailers del E3 dejaban entrever el magnífico reestreno que iba a tener esta saga de culto después de tantos años en el olvido... aunque la alegría fue seguida de una noticia amarga: iba a ser exclusivo de las consolas de Sony.  

Ya ha pasado algún tiempo desde su llegada a steam. Y es ahora cuando me doy cuenta del calado que supuso la decisión tomada por Arc System Works, al realizar este port en un periodo en el que los estudios nipones no apostaban por el pc.

Es por esa razón que considero a Guilty Gear Xrd como uno de esos juegos que marcan época. No solo se trata de una obra que homenajea a los fighting de los 90 en cada detalle imaginable, sino que fue toda una declaración de intenciones por parte de un estudio japonés que, contra todo pronostico, dio un paso adelante y nos regalo uno de los mejores juegos de lucha de esta generación. 10/10.

31872136.review:
[b]Good fighter overall, but not too appealing to me.[/b]

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

This is the best part of the game. The game runs in a 3d engine, but somehow, I guess it was through cell shading or something, it pretty much looks like an enhanced version of the 2d cartoon/anime style the previous guilty gear installments had. It's really revolutionary from my point of view: a game that is made in 3d but manages to look just like 2d anime. At first, you only notice it's 3d when you win a round and the camera spins around you and your opponent, displaying the final blow. Oh, if only game series like KOF could follow this art direction instead of those horrendous PS2 graphics...

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Gameplay is kinda based on the Marvel vs Capcom series: most characters have A->B->C combos that end into a special move like a fireball or something. There are also longer combos with aerial launchers but I didn't dive that much into the guilty gear combo system to pull off those easily (on a side note: I hate tutorials!). Overall, the gameplay seems to be much deeper that the typical anime fighter and it requires hours spent on the training mode to able to achieve a decent level with a particular character.

[h1]Story[/h1]

I don't have much to say about the story, it just sounded like some weird weeaboo bullcrap full of weird names and cross references. Fortunately, you dont need to know anything about the story whatsoever to start punching faces and throwing fireballs on the arcade mode.

[b]I Rate it 3.8/5.0[/b]

31242004.review: I hate this game, but the reasons are mostly personal preference. That's the reason I have over 10 hours of play time; I keep going back in the hope I'll find something to like. However, each time I try to play this I recoil with greater and greater levels of disgust. The music, especially the empty guitar riffs, do nothing for me. I have no interest in almost all of the characters. The characters themselves are all so varied that learning to play one character doesn't necessarily carry over the way it does in other fighting games. At the same time, the offerings in terms of grapplers are horribly sparse; most seem more like "strikers" and rely on flashy anime combos. The one character that I found interesting is one I struggled so much to play I stopped having any fun at all. The online scene is already so experienced that there's no hope for new players. The story pathetic. The arcade mode is bland. The extra single player mode, M.O.M., is just more difficulty that wasn't teaching me anything. Training is a highlight of this otherwise regretful package. This is all before even considering Arc System Work's insistence on staying with the old fighting game distribution method of breaking the game into versions... I'm done.

31063670.review:
Look, I'm only being realistic when I say: this game is probably too confusing for the vast majority of you. Is it a good fighting game? Abso-f*cking-lutely. But for anyone not playing Fighting games super seriously at a competitive level this is just not enjoyable.

It is also the most complex one I have ever tried in my life. You have like 3-4 meters to manage. Counter moves upon special counters upon even more different kinds of counter moves, cancels, slow-times, instakills, overdrives, reversals... There's just SOOOOO many mechanics. The only thing it lacks are combo moves. You can combine attacks any way you want. It is up to you to find out which ones are the good combinations. 

The fact that it took me 2 hours just to get through the tutorial in order to understand and memorize anything at all, speaks volumes. And that taught me only the "basics". The game actually has a very extensive tutorial system, with missions where you can practice a particular set of mechanics, frame-timing, reactions, moves, etc. The weird thing about this tutorial is that it doesn't teach you how to play with each character. Instead, it teaches you how to play [i]a fighting game[/i] properly. It teaches you the mentality behind it and gradually combines all the stuff you learned.

This game has a ridiculously high skill ceiling (and probably also skill floor). People playing fighting games at the very highest level will enjoy this, because it gives even them a challenge. This isn't Mortal Kombat, kids. This isn't Street Fighter. It's not Injustice (and that was a game which was already a bit too complex for my friend after playing MK and that game doesn't even come close to Guilty Gear).

If fighting games are like something like your "main" games, sure, go ahead, buy this. You won't regret it, I promise. For anyone else...

There's little reason to own this since Revelator exists (and there will be even LESS reason once Rev 2 hits the Steam store), but it's not a bad game on its own! The adrenaline rush one feels when playing Guilty Gear is still strong with this one!

I guess if you REALLY wanna experience the "latest" incarnation of Guilty Gear, but don't have enough money for Revelator, you could buy Sign as a cheaper alternative. Online's pretty much abandoned, but finding people to play with is easier than one may think.

Unique to Sign is its story mode (which takes place before Revelator) the altered visuals (which some may prefer over those of Rev) and the English dub (which, although better than the GGX trailer dub, is still just OK for the most part).

30891083.review:
Primero he de ser claro, soy fan de este genero de juegos desde pequeño, pero no he estado muy al tanto de sagas como esta o por ejemplo Blazblue, asi que no sabría deciros que diferencias hay entre los dos y cosas por el estilo. 

Aun así, este juego me parece imprescindible si eres un aficionado a los juegos de lucha en 2D, tanto por su jugabilidad, banda sonora y estilo gráfico, se que esto último no es lo más importante, pero el uso del 3D haciendo parecer anime es maravilloso. 

En cuanto a jugabilidad, es un juego que se basa en practicar combos y practicar aun más, si ya estás acostumbrado a estos juegos no te costará tanto, pero si eres nuevo te aseguro que en algún momento te verás aporreando botones como un loco intentando hacer combos. 

Y la banda sonora es MARAVILLOSA, no se puede decir otra cosa de ello.

Si le tuviese que dar una nota a este juego sería un 9/10 dentro de este genero.

30889127.review:
A good looking, sounding and fun game. Recommended to get the latest version.

A great fighting game with a solid tutorial that has everything to teach you to "git gud" and even goes into more depth with characters and useful combos + more.

Plenty of single player content, great music and visuals, online is smooth and interactive, with plenty of people on the GG discords and even more information on r/GuiltyGear.

Recommended 100% for ANY fighting game and/or anime fans.

30885817.review:
Game is only worth it if you are a completionist for owning every part of Xrd.

The game came out way late on PC although fairly well optimized (it still has minor issues and possibly some memory leak issues remaining), and the followup expansion came out late as well.

Also, the online community is virtually dead.

If you want to play Guilty Gear Xrd (namely a better version), just buy Revelator, or Revelator 2 whenever it comes out on PC (probably well after consoles a third time sadly).

30492838.review:
Это моя первая GUILTY GEAR (Надеюсь что не последняя).
Это замечательный файтинг, одновременно с низким и высоким пороком вхождения (Для мультиплеера, т.к там неистовые задроты).
Имеется довольно интересный режим истории со сложными боссами. 
Довольно красиво выглядят комбо и различные атаки, да и сама игра очень красочная, с отличной оптимизацией.
Особо на шарю в этой вселенной, но любители Мортал Комбата явно заценят, ну и любителям GUILTY GEAR обязательно брать. 
За пред заказ, давали все DLC что очень приятно.
Моя оценка - ''Обязательно стоит попробовать любителям файтингов из 10''
Очень благодарен человеку, который познакомил меня с данной вселенной.

29564493.review:
Guilty Gear, на мой взгляд, один из самых лучших 2Д файтингов из всех, которые мне довелось видеть. Классная стилистика, ураганный темп игры, интересный сюжет. Но, увы, я так долго ждал новые версии ГГ на ПК, (с 2008-го, вроде бы), что успел потерять к нему всякий интерес, благо, что в свет на ПК вышел ББ. И вот, однажды, знаете что? в 2016 году я, интереса ради, забиваю Guilty Gear в поисковик Стима - и обнаруживаю целую кучу ГГшек,включая АС+. Из любопытства я полазил по инету и узнал, что через пару дней портанут и Экзард. Да, я с удовольствием вспомнил старые ощущения и всё прочее, но, знаете, в чём беда? В онлайне пусто, как в голове разработчиков инди-хорроров на Юнити 10 iz 10 edition, от обилия которых рещит весь Гринлайт. Разрабы настолько ленивые задницы, что даже не удосужились хотя бы простейший пиар проделать! Итог - онлайн состоит целиком и полностью из игроков, которых я, по меркам онлайнового ГГ (да, если кто не знал, на Миднайт Карнавал была возможность состряпать онлайн),  варьируются А-S - рангами. То есть, либо надрачивайся до потери пульса с ботами, и потом только тягай с профи, либо вообще никак. Я, всё же, достиг каких-то успехов, только бодаясь с игроками, близких мне по скиллу. У меня нет уже старого запала, как раньше, я хочу просто помешить с игроками С-ранга и расслабиться. 

Увы, но здесь только фанаты. И, знаете, это очень грустно, когда действительно потрясающий файтинг с офигенным сюжетом, который, в своё время, покорил моё сердце и завоевал приличную аудиторию, остаётся безызвестным, зато Стим постоянно предлагает мне этот проклятый Скуллгёрлз, который знает каждый школьник, увлекающийся подобными файтингами! 

В остальном, я настоятельно рекомендую эту игру. Guilty Gear - один из самых лучших в своём жанре. Я надеюсь, что ленивые разрабы подымут свои зады и начнут пиарить свои продукты.

Guilty Gear - это когда гигантский исполин оказывается художником
Guilty Gear - это когда у одного робота просыпается непреодолимая тяга к женской красоте!
Guilty Gear - это когда у того же робота заряд пафоса класса "спасение Человечества" сравним с 10-ю своими оригиналами!
Guilty Gear - это когда "ЗАБАНЬТЕ ПТИЦЕЛУП!"
Guilty Gear - это когда утром подъем начинается с ДП
Guilty Gear - это когда ВЕРНИТЕ МУЖИКА-С-ДВЕРЬЮ
Guilty Gear - это когда ты стриггеришь просто все события,которые только возможно- и всё равно получишь  от пламенеющего фаната Квинов
Guilty Gear - это когда ты перепробуешь все ИК на всех персонажах
Guilty Gear - это когда ВРЕМЯ КЛИЗМЫ


10 Мужиков-с-дверью из 10

29362438.review:
Pros:
1: Fantastic graphics that succeed in creating the faux-2D efffect that developers of cel-shaded games have been trying & failing to do for decades; a noteable achievement that perhaps will mark the standard of future anime-styled games.
2: Engaging story & universe full of pure awesome style and a rich legacy in fighting game history.
3: Loveable characters with vibrant, deep personalities.
4: Simple, accessible gameplay that allows for anyone to get into it, while retaining some complexity for the hardcore crowd.
5: Fantastic English dub with distinct voices that fit each character, granting you relief from the terrible Japanese voices that all sound the same. This, for many, places it above -REVELATOR- in quality, a sentiment I strongly agree with.

Cons: 
A fairly limited roster for a game in this day & age, that relies a bit too much on new characters, considering the history of the Guilty Gear games' distinct, well-known characters.

A 12-character fighting game (+3 extra characters ONLY for console players). The game features few characters because they are so complex and unique, it would take you months to "decently" learn how to use ONE of them; so I do not recommend this game if you are a casual gamer.
Story mode is a series of RPG-like conversations-you don't get to fight-, so you don't "complete" anything in this game. It's all arcade or multiplayer.

28792487.review:
之前一直是ARC社BB系列的玩家，Xrd sign是我接触的第一款GG系列的作品，怎么说呢，即使是长期接触以画风精美而被誉为新世纪GAL的BB系列，Xrd也让我感到比较惊艳，arc的3d渲2d技术真的堪称极致，暂时来说最华丽的2d格斗游戏。个人非常希望BB和kof系列也能用这种技术（虽然后者毫无可能....），bb系列的点阵绘还是太老旧了。
作为BB的姊妹作，两者的系统有很大程度的相似之处，而且没有BB系列的角色Drive系统，本以为GG的难度会和BB差不多，但实际上GG的难度还是要高于BB。即使有详细的新手指引，但是我已经彻底沦为了智障...
不过，即使是手残也是可以买来玩的，arc社对于ftg在未来的出路，还是做出了许多的改变和妥协，比如说BB系列的买gal送游戏，再比如说这作的买番送游戏，打剧情和人设、画面牌，再配合上良心的定价，还是值得一玩。

but，，，，这联机同城ip冲突怎么回事啊。。。BB系列没一作有这问题啊   有生之年修正了再改好评

28412785.review:
Etant un fondu de la serie GG j'attendais ce premier opus de la nouvelle refonte de pied ferme.

Pour commencer la DA et à tomber par terre, le rendu et vraiment splendide. Comme tout les jeux ark sys le jeu met une vraie baffe dans la tronche avec cette DA, c'est pour ma part le plus beau soft de frappe sur le marché comme le fut en son temps le premier GG quand il et apparue debut 2000.

Au niveau du coeur de jeu cela à pas mal changer, on va dire que le jeu et plus accessible pour les debutant que la premiere serie de GG mais qu'au fond son gameplay et pas loin d'etre aussi riche que les anciens opus, donc pour les vieux frappeur de la serie on  si retrouve sans souci.

Le contenue et vraiment riche on en à pour son argent meme si le rooster et leger mais c'est toujours de la sorte avec les jeux arc sys, on aura droit à une chié de version dans le futur comme avec deja Revelator que je possede sur PS4 et qui deboite encore plus que ce XRD.

Le mode online marche au poil, c'est loin d'etre le cas de la concurrence, bon point.

Bref cette premiere version de la serie XRD donne de grand espoir pour la suite, je le recommande chaudement, GG etant ma licence de frappe préféré.

28142607.review:
Я определённо советую Guilty Gear.
[b] Главное, что я хочу сообщить в обзоре на Xrd -SIGN-.  15 декабря 2016, выходит Guilty Gear Relevator. Это новая часть. Поэтому если кто-то подумывает купить Xrd, то лучше подождать выхода Relevator'a.[/b]
Серия Guilty Gear отличный многокнопочный файтинг . На самом деле это именно тот файтинг, который показал мне, что файтинги могут быть дейсвительно интересными глубокими в плане механики.
До знакомств с этой серией я играл в Мортал Комбат 3-4, Теккен 3, Стрит Файтеры старого образца. С друзьями ещё в версус неплохо, а одному вот совсем не шло.
Когда же ко мне в руки попал Guilty Gear Isuka и Guilty Gear Reload всё изменилось. Я днями играл аркаду за всех персонажей, истории, сурвайвал мод. (В Guilty Gear Isuka ещё был режим 2 на 2 (одновременно) вот это было то ещё веселье)
Я наловчился убивать ботов максимальной сложности на любом персонаже. Выучил все суперудары за всех персонажей. До сих пор помню и использую).
Впоследствии мы часто зависали с друзьями играя в Guilty Gear Reload целыми вечарами после школы =D. Даже дубасили друг друга бокенами для "эффекта присутствия" =D. Двое играли, а третий бил того, кто пропускает удары =D.
А затем уже появился онлайн. Настоящий мордобой.
К чему я это лирическое отсутпление. На данный момент я играю почти во все выходящие файтинги. И ни один больше меня так не зацепил. Если вы играли в новые файтинги и они вас не зацепили. То стоит дать шанс гульти гиру. Возможно он зацепит Вас также, как меня.
Отдельно стоит отметить музыку. Это прекрасный тяжелый рок/метал. На будильнике и на телефоне стоят мелодиии из игры)  
Одной из заметных особенностей Guilty Gear является Instant Kill. Это мгновенное убийство. Если враг не заблокирует это приём, то он красиво умрёт (типа, фаталити). В онлайне эта способность добавляет очень много дров для огня.
Если переходить к Guilty Gear Xrd. 
Графика - определённо стала лучше. Многие боялись, что перенос в 3д может плохо сказаться на графике, ведь до этого были 2д спрайты. Но, к счастью персонажи отрендеренены в 3д, а потом сохранены определённые 2д кадры для анимаций. Выглядит замечательно! Задний план завораживает. Селл-шейдинг в игровых заставках является лучшим применений данной технологии, что я видел.
Геймплейно (не на про уровне), почти ничего не изменилось. Что для меня, как фаната старых частей, прекрасно.
А вот сюжет и общая стилистика...
Я не понял, почему начиная с Guilty Gear Overture изменилась стилистика... Вместо тяжелого металла начали вплетать всякие тубы и органы. Это само по себе неплохо. Но ведь у гульти гир уже была своя атмосфера..
Персонажи начали получать в элементы одежды какие-то непонятные детали (Потёмкину аниме шлем?), подменили эпоху действия. Появились, внезапно, короли...
Дальше хуже. В Xrd убрали очень многих персонажей из предыдущих частей. А новые это просто аниме штампы... Девочка-майден, которая хочет на всех жениться (после победы)??? (геймплейно она норм, но дизайн!) Король с двумя кастетами вообще копия леди-грудь-фурри из блазблю по геймплею. А вот син, кстати, неплох. Но его "майка" очень странная, опять же, для файтинга который начинался во время классических аниме (Гульти гир у меня всегда почему-то ассоциировался с Триганом, например) и был метальный до верхушек.
Я думал для всего этого популярного аниме-потребства арк систем как раз и сделали BlazBlue. Но нет, зараза передалась и на гульти гир.
Про сюжет. Тут есть стори режим - визуальная новелла. И как я уже утмечал, сюжет нового гульти гира очень сильно пропитан штампами. Капля оригинальность всё ещё осталась. Но тема гиров, например, уже не главная. Некоторые сюжетные повороты так вообще заставляли меня делать рука-лицо.
Также у меня стоит вопрос почему убрали так много старых персонажей??? На данный момент мне большего всего обидно за Zappa. Офигенный, оригинальный персонаж со злым духом из звонка). Но его убрали. А в Relevator'e ввели Jack-o, аниме полу-лоли девочку в маске тыквы, у которой довольно похожая боевая механика, основанная на вызове помощников и бросках...
Чтобы окончательно убедиться, как изменился гультир гир достаточно посмотреть на персонажа Raven из Guiltye Gear XX и его играбельную версию из Guilty Gear Relevator...
Но в итоге я всё равно люблю Guilty Gear. Прекрасная графика, отличный зубодробительный геймплей, всё ещё плюс-минус оригинальный сеттинг (история - нет), полюбившиеся персонажи (хоть и в новом виде). Да и музыка всё ещё держит планку. А от дорожки Holy Order когда у Кая в бою расплетаются волосы мне просто сносит крышу)

28048433.review:
Просто, самый фановый,самый крышесносный файтинг евер. 
Офигенный визуал - самобытный, сделанный с гиковской постановкой и детализацией; не настолько безвкусный анимэ дженерик стайл ,как БлазБлу. (Стилистика и образы всегда в серии были на высоте,но тут - просто новый уровень,одни интро тут чего стоят.) Персы - каждый уникальный и играется по разному, стереотипных или клонированных чаров,как в др. файтингах, здесь гораздо меньше, с креативом полный порядок (Что бы не говорили про отличия рю,кена,акумы,сакуры,сагата и пр.; да, между ними хватает отличий в деталях, особенно в 5, где благодаря новым механикам - это больше выражено, но принцип в итоге один и тот же; перейти с одного чара, на другого - такого же типа и, научится играть, гораздо легче).
 Но самое главное, динамичность и одновременно глубина самой механики.(мэшеры тоже смогут получить удовольствие, только в онлайн им... лучше сразу не соваться, комьюнити здесь довольно скилованное, но немногочисленное, большинство перебралось еще со времен reload ). Сидеть в защите тут не приветствуется, а также не малая часть процесса происходит в воздухе! Туториалы доходчиво и обстоятельно объясняют все тонкости боевки. Всем разрабам учится так делать - внятно,обстоятельно и не "на отвались, идите на ютуб ". Еще прилагаются челленджи для разных ситуаций и положений в которых игрок может оказаться. Тоже говорит о том, что разработчики пекутся о новичках, и хотят сделать не самый простой жанр,чуточку понятнее для игроков разных масс. Тоже приятно.
Метольчик!(Хотя, не всегда годный, на самом деле,саунд на фоне предшественника скорей разочаровал, но некоторые вокальные пост-кредит партии зашли ).
Сетевой код на удивление отзывчивый(В зависимости от региона). Оптимизация роскошная (на моем ведре шестилетней давности, идет в фулл хд и на высоких, достойно похвалы). Охрененный туториал, теккену бы такой! 
В общем, забейте на МК,забейте на SF, бегом в GG. Те кто играет в 2D файтинги и любит этот жанр, должны хотя бы попробовать.(Да, я куда больше времени провожу в сф по простым причинам, в нем легче добиться результата и приходится зарабатывать фм для открытия новых чаров в сезоннах. Но не могу не отметить заслуги гг, его место как топ файтинга,возможно лучшего на сегодняшний день.)

27557869.review:
Guilty gear Xrd was, and is, a revolutionary fighting game - not to mention a new take on the medium of videogames and fighting games as a genre.

At the time of this writing, the game's largely obsoleted by Revelator. While the original plan was to have just a single 'Xrd' game, with new content added as DLC updates, meddling on the part of Valve ('a contract is a contract is a contract!'), as well as Arc being new to the whole thing, that didn't came to be, and Xrd is essentially a graveyard.

However, one must remember it for what it was, is, and aimed to be, not what ended up as. Rather than the 'traditional' formula of essentially zero singleplayer content, heroic scale characters, karate men with karate uniforms doing karate sumo wrestling on each other from 1992 to 2015, little to no continuity, and an unwillingness to challenge established norms, Xrd returns to what made the series so great and successful, and refuses outright to deviate from the, and I quote, red path. No corners were cut, no challenge considered too great, deadlines were met, and no expenses spared - which considering the small team and minimal budget, is quite the accomplishment.

If you don't know, and odds are you might not, GG has and always will be masterminded by Daisuke Ishiwatari, a man who has a very clear, very defined vision. When other franchises go wild with singleplayer modes, he and his handpicked teammates read between the lines. It's not singleplayer that's in vogue. It's an entire experience. So Xrd features an extensive three act anime movie, that while not comparable in technical prowess to what would come in Revelator, features an all-star cast, and ties up ten years of questions, while also weaving in formerly very unpopular/poorly received features, like guilty gear 2 overture's story changes.

Everything, the anime movie included, has an 80s style to it. 80s guitars, characters with lines that would have fit in just fine in fist of the north star, plot twists that seem absurd at first glance, but make more than enough sense when examined even cursory, not to mention designs that go above and beyond the self-parody that is modern day final fantasy. For instance, Sol Badguy has a grand total of 34 zippers and belts, which is more than your average FF character, but he carries himself with a purpose and flair that makes him less about the belts and zippers, and more about his 80s brit-scene metal theme songs, his gameplay flow, and the voice acting. In short, the whole package.

In a sudden return to form, Ky, formerly perfectionist child soldier and warrior prodigy, is allowed to grow as a character, while also returning certain essential characteristics that haven't been seen since #Reloaded and the accompanying books and drama CDs. Hint. he's a devout christian, and has had a lifelong struggle with the fact that all he's ever been good at, all he's ever had in life, and all he's ever been noted for, is how incredibly, utterly, incomprehensively masterful he is at killing everything and everyone, but to mark that he's actually for real grown, rather than the traditional, casual call out that he's setting up for a finisher ('sacred order ultimate forbidden technique. RISING FORCE!') he recites his oaths to his family and kingdom in a most biblical fashion, no calling the move necessary, charges full speed through a master level lightning magic circle, to remind us of why this regular human dude is able to hang with bio-weapons, monsters, the undead, and other assorted weirdos, gives a most humiliating, but for once actually true, one liner, puts on his cape, and just walks away matter of factly. I believe it's up there in the top ten most boss moments of videogames.

Speaking of the voice actors, you'll be hard pressed to find a franchise with a more star studded cast, and like the gameplay and attention to detail, it's never waivered, and never will. It's hard to believe it's been almost two decades since Takeshi Kusao starred in the first ever guilty gear on the playstation, and in a sense, he's largely typecast himself as Ky. A fun little thing is watching the future Trunks episodes on dragon ball super. He tries very hard to do Trunks, but in the end, they give him a lighting sword, sacred edges, and lets him do the equivalent of a rising force destroy on the big bad, and it's hard to disbelief his conviction.

So would I recommend a fighting game that's essentially got no future due to executive meddling? For 15 dollars or less...surprisingly, yes. There's enough singleplayer stuff here for at least 20 hours of fun, and I consider Xrd an essential purchase for anyone who considers themselves a guilty gear fan. While a lot of mocking has been thrown at the animemes, the production value makes it worth your while, and just getting the universe explained to you, especially if you maybe played an X2 game in the long distant past, is pretty useful. Also note that while Rev is the future, Rev as far as we know will never feature the Xrd singleplayer stuff, mostly importantly the story mode. Another important thing to note is that Arc, unlike about 99.99% of all other publishers, absolutely love and cherish their fans and community, and will give you price cuts on future games in a franchise if own old entries.

Future updates will be added to GG Revelator. When you're reading this, odds are, that game is on Rev 2.

As a side note, it's incredibly interesting to me that 80s animation tricks and voice actors that actually knows what they're doing manage to outshine, outperform, and completely obliterate modern day anime, even when the anime is merely a fanservice addition to a fighting game, and the fighting game in question is on unreal 3 of all engines.

27369639.review:
I still remember the first time I laid eyes on the [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NKGPhKu3jNg]first trailer[/url] for this game.  It was sometime in March, 2013, and I was immediately glued to the screen.  It had been a long time since Accent Core, and after so many Blazblue titles, I was starting to think that [i]Guilty Gear 2: Overture[/i] would be the last game in the series.  When I saw Sol and Ky having a quick chat, my initial thought was, "Huh, so they did update the sprites.  They look kinda bulky, but not bad!"

And then the camera [i]rotated[/i] and I was stuck staring, wide-eyed and open-mouthed at the witchcraft playing on my screen.

Seeing just how pitch-perfect everything was, from shadows to animation to the feel of impact in each attack, was amazing.  I couldn't stop watching.  I repeated it over and over, trying to find new details, trying to absorb the sheer magnitude of what they'd accomplished.  Normally, the wonder would diminish as I get more and more used to it, but watching their [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yhGjCzxJV3E]GDC presentation[/url] of how they did it only makes me marvel at their genius and skill all the more.  This game is a prime example of why aesthetics will always trump technology.

Even mechanics-wise, it's an excellent revision, cutting away or better integrating the added mechanics and techniques from Slash to Accent Core, and reworking the Roman Cancel system to make the game more accessible to newbies while offering plenty of depth to veterans.  While -SIGN-'s gameplay isn't as good as its sequel, -REVELATOR-, the framework is all here, and it's easily the best-looking and one of the best-playing fighting games available on Steam.

They sure kept me waiting, but I'm still ready to rock.

27081956.review:
When I first saw the trailer for GG Xrd I could not believe my eyes. One of the best fighting game series ever made became even more awesome. Shivers, shock... is this realy happening? 

[b]What's the game like?[/b]
Guilty Gear has a crazy, unique cast, none of the characters feels like a clone of some other one. Every one of them has a distinct personality and set of moves. The exellent story for many may be an addition to a fighting game, but if you're playing a game only for the story you won't get disappointed. Xrd features a massive glossary so if a in-game term is confusing just check it out.

[b]But what about the audio-visual experience?[/b]
Amazing graphics, eye candy, in my opinion this is the way fighting games should look like, just check out the screens for yourself. The soundtrack is a masterpiece, I keep listening to it just like I would to any epic album from the top charts.

[b]But I'm not good at fighting games.[/b]
Thats not a problem, this game has a great and very long tutorial that explains the game mechanics. There are also missions and trials for every character to help you getting started. The community is very helpful too.

[b]OK, but does this game have any flaws?[/b]
Nothing is perfect but this game is very close to it. I wish all characters from previous GG games would fit into it. And it seems like slowly they are making their way into the game with the new iterations coming out.
I also wish the player base would be bigger. This could be done by implementing cross play with PS3&4. Don't get me wrong there are plenty of players to play with but not as many as in you know what game.

So please buy this game, tell your friends about it and enjoy.

It's fun, it has an amazing soundtrack, amazing graphics. Could you want more than this? Oh right, getting Revelator on PC and probably a Baiken DLC, but I guess we'll [i] probably [/i] have to wait another couple of months. ...Or years.

But let's get to the quick review, shall we?

[h1] Positives [/h1]

[list]
[*] It's an actual [b] NEW [/b] Guilty Gear game.
[*] Graphically it's a masterpiece. How many people do you think got fooled and thought it was in 2D with HD sprites, huh? 'Cuz I was one of them.
[*] It's a new Guilty Gear.
[*] Soundtrack is composed by Daisuke Ishiwatari (At least the metal ones). 'Nuff said.
[*] Did I mentioned that it's a new Guilty Gear? I DID, but to be honest, I'm never tired of saying it.
[*] The story (If you [i] actually [/i] care), it's pretty good (or at least entertaining) and unlike [i] other games [/i] this one is actually pretty easy to understand and has pretty good characters too. At least to me, I not disliked the characters. Not one bit. ...Except Bedman, but it's actually a pretty cool guy at the end of the day.
[*] If you don't understand something, there's a library where you can find all those little bits of data. And there is a ton of character information, in case you wanna know more about your favorite characters. Or maybe you're just like me and read all those things because you [strike] had nothing better to do [/strike] got interested and wanted to know more.
[*] 17 [b] UNIQUE [/b] characters. Seriously, every character has a different gameplay. Not one is a copy of another character, unlike a certain game with some dudes fighting on the street.
[/list]

[h1] Negatives [/h1]

[list]
[*] First off, this actually may be a personal problem because I love unlocking unnecesary things, but c'moooooon, couldn't you guys put more in the gallery? BlazBlue has like a... How do you say a number when it has a ton of zeroes? Anyway, the thing is that it has a TON of things to unlock. Guilty Gear on the other hand... It has a couple of songs, some movies and, if you didn't bought the character DLC, Sin, Elphelt and Leo. There ARE some few more items that you can unlock, but nothing more. So yeah, within, what? ten hours you can unlock all? Shame on you, ArcSys... Shame on you...
[*] Netplay is as dead as it could be. Try and find a room. I dare you. I Double Dragon dare you.
[*] The AI is too easy. Way. Too. Easy. Seriously, you can beat the arcade mode on maniac and you will barely get pounded like three to four times, and if you're good at the game, you will most likely do the same as me and put the game to best of 8 because battles last like a minute and a half. And M.O.M. is a liiiittle more difficult, but it's mostly because it's survival mode and you'll most likely end up starting a fight with barely any HP. So yeah, AI sucks.
[*] The Vocal Collection is cheap. Veeery cheap. 10 songs in 192 kbps. C'mon, if you're gonna give us so little music, at least give it to us in high quality.
[/list]

Overall, Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN- is a pretty fun game, with fun mechanics, like when you clash with your opponent and you enter the "Danger Zone" as I like to call it, when [b] EVERYTHING [/b] can make a combo with [b] ANYTHING [/b], and all your hits are Criticals. Do I recommend it? I couldn't recommend it enough. Is it worth buying? Absolutely. Is Elphelt the best waifu in Guilty Gear? [b] HELL YEAH [/b].

So yeah, go buy it, especially now that, at the moment of this review, has a 50% discount. Once you've bought it, play it. Play it until your fingers become metal.

26892818.review:
Never had I been as happy of a game series coming back as I was when it was announced that Guilty Gear was coming to the next generations of consoles, and for once the wait paid off. In the midst of endless amounts of Blazblue re-releases, it's so refreshing to play a more straightforward fighting game with a less convoluted plot for once.

The 2d-but-actually-3D look is really impressive and adds that extra oomph to finishers and special moves. The soundtrack might not be as harsh and full-on, balls-to-the-falls heavy on the rock department as its predecessors, but it'll grow on you as you listen to it while trying to perfect that one frame perfect move in the middle of that excruciatingly long combo, but that's besides the point. The English voice acting is a mixed bag of some really good and unique performances(Faust, Slayer, and Bedman to name a few), though generally I'd recommend switching to the Japanese one.

The gameplay has taken a few steps back, e.g. removing certain moves and systems, the cast is only half as big etc., and, as such, resembles XX2: Reloaded a lot more than its updated re-releases. However, this in my opinion streamlines the gameplay so it is easier to pick up and learn, also thanks to the decent tutorial and challenge modes, but is still hard to master. The time window when executing a a Roman cancel has also been made a bit longer and more visually noticeable, which is always nice, and being too defensive is very much discouraged with penalties affecting your tension gain, so an aggressive playstyle is the way to go.

Now for the less important stuff. Unlocking miscellaneous stuff, such as new characters, announcers, color palettes etc., doesn't take too long, as completing challenges and clearing each character's arcade mode nets in-game currency quite fast, though you can just buy them with real money if it still feels too tedious. The story this time around is told in a visual novel format. It's still advisable that you complete the arcade modes to understand some scenes, but you won't miss anything too special if you jump straight into story. I do kind of miss having the story be more ingrained to the gameplay and the various branching story paths, as they added more replay value and also presented some cool what-if scenarios. As of the story itself: it's okayish, though I would have preferred if they hadn't just copy-pasted ideas and plotpoints from Blazblue to Guilty Gear.

As of now, Guilty Gear Xrd - Revelator hasn't come to Steam yet, so this is still the definitive GG experience. However, knowing Aksys Games' publishing schedules regarding pc releases, Revelator might be coming at least in early 2017. If you have the patience, wait for that.

26745877.review:
Llegó el momento que nunca pensé que llegaría. Guilty Gear pasándose a las 3D. Pero de una manera que nadie nos hubiéramos imaginado y con un acierto que a día de hoy ningún otro producto cell-shading (exceptuando los juegos de Cyberconnect 2) ha conseguido.

Guilty Gear Xrd es la última parte de una saga de lucha muy reconocido por sus mecánicas profundas y su gran roster de luchadores. Este Guilty Gear no se queda simplemente en los diseños clásicos de los personajes y los evoluciona dejando toda su esencia intacta e incluso mejorando lo presente (como siempre Ark System Works haciendo su magia) a la vez que añadiendo nuevos personajes que encajan perfectamente dentro del universo del juego.

La BSO de Guilty Gear Xrd sigue la misma línea que toda la saga, rockera, intensa y muy cautivadora. La música es el perfecto complemento a la hora de jugar y hay cierto elemento que no todo el mundo tiene en cuenta, la música se adapta a lo que está ocurriendo el combate, enfatizando las situaciones y sobre todo animando al jugador a meterse dentro del ritmo de la lucha. Un 10/10 en este aspecto como siempre.

La jugabilidad clásica de Guilty Gear sigue presente dentro de este juego con un par de añadidos que hacen que la profundidad de este juego siempre sea bastante amplia y te obligue a aprenderte el roster para sacarle el máximo jugo a los match ups y poder aprovechar al máximo las posibilidades.

El modo historia es un añadido realmente interesante y no engaña, es sólo historia, donde se profundiza sobre la historia mediante una serie de cut-scenes realizadas con el propio motor del juego que demuestra el potencial del motor Unreal modificado por Ark System Works. Reconozco que me he quedado con muchas ganas de ver cómo continua la historia y que me he reído varias veces con las situaciones de este modo.

El modo online cuenta con dos variantes, rankeds, que funcionan por personaje y no por la cuenta en si, y con casual. Lo mejor de ambos es el systema de hub online diseñado para poder jugar en una misma sala con varias personas a la vez. No comprendo como otros juegos de lucha no han hecho esto aún y no es obligatorios en otros títulos dentro del mismo género. Lag mínimo y partidas muy divertidas e igualadas.

¿Recomendable? Sí, demasiado. Como amante de los juegos de lucha con un arcade stick competitivo puedo decir que este juego me da todo lo que pido y más. Si te gustan los juegos de lucha 2D con buena jugabilidad ahora mismo es tu mejor opción por encima de Street Fighter V.

26728381.review:
. Steam permet d'avoir un contenu incroyable en terme de jeux. Nous trouvons des titres indépendants, des genres oubliés comme les shoot them up et bien d'autres styles.  Et si on possède un PC récent, on se prend au jeu de comparer différentes versions d'un titre. En effet lorsque nous voyons SF V sur PS4 et celle d'un PC, on peut clairement affirmer : il n'y a pas photo, sur vos bécanes tout est lisse et extrêment fluide et bourré de détails.

. Les jeux versus Fighting trouvent une renaissance sur steam et on peut avoir une très belle collection, en l'occurence avec la série des Guilty Gear qui a connu de droles d'évolutions, une saga en dents de scie, et le novice ne sera pas quoi choisir.

. Avec son ambiance métallo-dark, des looks énervés du casting aux riffs de guitare électrisants, Guilty Gear joue un peu le rôle du bad boy des jeux de baston. La série est aussi connue pour toujours proposer un spectacle léché, s'illustrant avec des personnages hauts en couleur et des animations pêchues. Belle comme un camion, elle fait néanmoins peur à bon nombre de prétendants. Son système de jeu extrêmement riche et relativement complexe, tel le playbook du plus calé des quaterbacks, demande en effet une très (trop ?) grosse période d'apprentissage. Avec Xrd, Arc System Works a revu sa copie pour plaire et correspondre au plus grand nombre. Pour le meilleur et pour le pire ?

. En revanche, le design général, pourtant jusqu'alors premier atout de la franchise, a subi un lifting pour le moins incongru... A la rigueur, que GG Xrd ait suivi cette tendance de rendre les protagonistes moins longilignes et plus costauds, comme d'autres candidats du VS Fighting

... Je ne vais pas me replonger de nouveau dans le gameplay qui demeure riche pour les fans de la série. On notera cependant que ce titre semble perdre du terrain face à la série Blazblue (quasiment les mêmes équipes de développement).

." Doté d'une réalisation technique impressionnante, Guilty Gear Xrd : Sign trébuche étrangement sur l'un des points forts de la franchise : sa direction artistique. " (Site Gameblog - Keem tam) Couplé au fait que le roster soit assez limité et que les personnages ne soient pas tous réussis au niveau de la prise en main, on est en droit de se montrer un brin déçu. Pourtant, le titre parvient à retenir notre attention, grâce à ses modes d'entraînement bien sentis, son online quasi-parfait et, au fond, la maîtrise de ses mécaniques de jeu. Bien qu'un peu plus simple que ses prédécesseurs, il s'adresse encore et toujours aux amateurs de challenge corsé.

26675983.review:
Due to the sheer amount of systems and playstyle variety, as well as jus the general busyness of the visuals, this game can be tough to get into for new players. The GG series was designed for people who thought Capcom's fighters were a little too vanilla.

However, the game has an absolutely INCREDIBLE tutorial and training mode that WILL teach you to play any fighting game, So for that alone, I would say this is a great game to get whether you've never played a fighting game or you're an old school vet. 

The gameplay is tight, the characters are all completely unique and look absolutely GORGEOUS. There's a full story mode if you're into that sort of thing, and it runs really well on a wide range of hardware.

Even if you aren't going to take this game seriously, it's still an easy recommend. One of the best fighting games on PC right now.

26529027.review:
If you're not familiar with the Guilty Gear series, it's all about turbocharged 2D anime fighting, complete with a totally over-the-top metal soundtrack and finishing moves which will melt your eyeballs. The new Xrd series stays true to the series trademark formula, and as a fairly casual beat'em up player I find this a lot more fun and easier to get into and play than Arc System Works other key fighting franchise BlazBlue.

Arc are seemingly on a bit of a roll of late, with both this and BlazBlue Chronophantasma hitting Steam earlier in 2016. Visually, BlazBlue is a 2D fighter delivered with traditional 2D sprites, but for the new Guilty Gear games they have gone about things very differently. The visuals here are delivered via Unreal Engine 3. Everything on screen is delivered in 3D, whilst retaining not only the 2D gameplay, but also the appearance of being 2D overall, bar extreme camera shifting moments when you realise it's not 2D at all.

It's a fascinating way of delivering anime-like cartoon visuals rendered in 3D, and the end result is just awesome. Games have strived to deliver this kind of cartoon-like visual presentation for years, but I've never seen it done better than it is here. It's also worth mentioning that in typical anime fashion, the whole game is glittered with excellent moments of comedy. The writing is on point and often funny af. If you're a fan of arcade fighters then it's not to be missed.

26045426.review:
Ну это тот ещё ОГОНЬ. Чёрт, это лучший файтинг, из тех что Я пробовал, но их было не много, так что это очень субъективное и казуальное высказывание. Но, чёрт, ещё какой огонь ... ОГНИЩЕ, прям.

Начну по порядку. Красивая, приятная, немного простенькая картинка в стиле японский мультяшек с мягком и хорошенькой анимацией ударов, взрывов и прочего подобного добра, что делает все происходящее на экране весьма интересным, прекрасным зрелищем. Семнадцать разнообразных цветастых по-японски безумных игровых персонажа: девчонка с большим якорем, парень в кровате-мехе, мужик напоминающий внешностью и именем льва, ведьма с гитарой, прям хороший такой набор. Как же люблю японцев за это их ... ну Вы поняли ... чудаковатость, фантазию и безбашенность. Ну и каждого боец уникален как в плане приемов, ударов и геймплане, так в образе и дизайне. Так что играются все довольно разнообразно. Реально гитарно-драйвовый и мощный саундтрек, который покорил меня, да очень и очень хорошо и вне игры слушается. Было бы здорово наличие альбома в виде одного из DLC, но такого не завезли, кроме какого-то маленького обрубка из десяти треков, в папке с игрой. И динамичные, быстрые, не менее чем музыка, пролетающие в мгновение бои. Сражения интересные, прикольные и очень быстрые, к ним надо привыкнуть, затем ловить адреналин. Поначалу мне механика казалось довольно простой, лежащей на поверхности и без проблем осваиваемой. Спустя время понял, что очень сильно ошибся. Игра является какой-то бездонной бездной для тренировки и постижения игровых азов, что может для многих стать проблемой. Но всё же, в неё неимоверно весело играть, по крайней мере мне, хоть и играю как днище. Да и к технической части никаких пререканий нет - багов, фризов или чего-то подобного за где-то сорок часов так и не увидел.

Всё это оставляет у меня очень положительные впечатления об игре. Есть подозрение, это именно то самое, что подарит мне ещё морю веселья и развлечения многие часы, а временами и боль в пальцах, ненависть к себе, на то это и файтинг.

Да есть несколько опущенных моментов, которые для меня не имеют особого веса, вот Я их и не описал. Например сюжетный режим, который представлен в виде пяти часового просмотра чисто роликов и диалогов персонажей, а, видимо, без знание лора эта мало из этого вряд ли можно получить удовольствие, вот Я и не особо старался. Ну и что-то ещё. Придираться мне вообще не к чему не хочется. Хотя нет, но это довольно маленький момент, но все же - кнопки в интерфейсе даже при подключенном или отключенном геймпаде всегда показывает секунду кнопку клавиатур, а в следующую секунду кнопку геймпада, что меня подбеливает временами. Всё.

Продолжаю любить "SIGN". И ждать релиза "Revelator" на ПК. Ныне любимый файтинг.

25761315.review:
Though I am recommending the game in this review, I would probably not buy Guilty Gear Xrd -Sign- for PC unless it is on sale for VERY cheap ($10-$20) and if you have someone you want to play it with. Though it was nice for them to release a PC version of this game, this is not the most recent version of Guilty Gear. Guilty Gear Xrd -Revelator- is the most recent version and it's available on PS3 and PS4. Though, if you do get this game, anything you learn in it will transfer over to the newest version.

Guilty Gear Xrd is an awesome fighting game. It has a ton of style, and is VERY fun to play but ONLY if you are very experienced in the fighting game genre. I would not get Xrd as one of your first fighting games. Although the tutorials are VERY informative, you will probably get destroyed by someone with fighting game experience very quickly and have NO idea what even happened. 

It's probably one of the greatest looking fighting games of all time. It has a 2D look, but it's all actually 3D models. I wouldn't really recommend Guilty Gear Xrd -Sign- unless you're a very experienced fighting game enthusiast, but the game does come with a semi-interesting 8 hour story mode, and arcade modes with their own cutscenes and content.

One of my favorite fighting games that I've played so far. Very stylish, the music kicks ass, the characters are all badass or hilarious. I've had tons of fun hours playing this with my friends locally and getting together with groups of people online and playing it. Though, because it isn't the latest version of the series, I would try to get Revelator on PS3/PS4 or only get this if you have another friend who has it.

25610510.review:
[strike]When's Revelator?[/strike]

Fast-paced and fun, Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN- is a phenomenal 2D fighting game, featuring a cast of unique characters, a plethora of fun moves, and smooth gameplay perfectly complimented by fantastic music and great graphics. The game's art style uses 3D models, but deliberately makes everything look 2D in order to channel the feel of the older Guilty Gear games, even going as far as to make several of the attack animations intentionally choppy. Strangely enough, that choppiness actually makes this game look better. I don't understand it either.

Of course, by the time this game came out on PC, people were already clamoring for the second Xrd game, -REVELATOR-, and by the time [i]that[/i] game releases on Steam we'll probably already have a third game in the works. This is still a very fun game, though. If there's one criticism I do have, it's that Arc System Works' games tend to not have the greatest netcode out there. The game's online functions well enough, but suffers from delay at times and doesn't seem to cooperate very well with streaming software, or at least it didn't for me.

Also the game has Elphelt Valentine and she is 150% cute so play this game okay

25103743.review:
Guilty Gear XRD -SIGN- вот это по истине достойный перезапуск полумёртвой франшизы. Собственно о полней смерти гилты никто не говорил, но что бы понимать о чём идёт речь, для тех кто не в курсе, проведу исторический лигбез. 
В 1998 году добрый дядя из Японии по имяни Дайсуке Исиватари дулает первую в серии игру под названием (как не удивительно, держитесь за стулья) Guilty Gear (далее GG). Затем в серии происходила такая пьянка: в 2000 году на свет рождается GG X, потом в 2003 GG XX, вот наконец GG Xrd. За каждым крестиком в названии скрывается по нескольку игр и всего их 19(!), но эти важнее всего, они так сказать делали переворот в визуале или механике. Само собой последняя годная ПК версия GG XX#Reload вышла аж в 2007 году, и соответственно все ждали некого прорыва, чтож вот теперь можно начать обзор.
 Графика. Ну что… ГРАФОООООООООН!!!! Я ради этого прокаченного графона на 4 анриале поменял себе видеокарту. Годно, и ничуть не диссонирует с оригиналом. Ставим жирный плюс!
Геймплей. Классический геймплей 1998 года. Классика, минимум изменений, что не может не радовать. Ураганный файтиг, если вы фанат какого нибудь МК или Соул Калибура, приспособится будет непросто, так как GG намного быстрее и резче.
Сюжет. Сюжетную компанию как токовую убрали, раньше она была встроена, как в других файтингах, но теперь это просто набор картинок с английскими субтитрами, которые мне читать лениво за плохим знанием последнего, но то что Чип стал президентом я оценил.
 Мультиплеер. Он есть. Раньше что бы поиграть по сети нужно было не слабо поизгалятся, но теперь он встроен и давольно хорош, не смотря на то что в большенстве случаев мне рвут попку. 
Музыка. Как всегда на высоте. Старые композиции в новом свете.
Персонажи. В данной версии были добавлено 5(!) новых персонажей. Что радует, так это то что все персонажи сбалансированы, лишь за Лео научится играть проще, чем за остальных. Всего представлено 17 персонажей и это мало по сравнению с другими играми серии.
Итог. Очень хороший ремейк, который дал то чего от него ждали. 8,5 потёлкиных из 10. Спасибо, занавес.

24981614.review:
ギルティギアは完璧です
PC/Playstation一緒に遊びます
売る -REVELATOR- PC
私たちはあなたを愛してます!

[url]https://youtu.be/F577tB8JvOc[/url]
[h1]Fighting aspects[/h1]
[url=https://youtu.be/pdllYC5GZNI?t=1h47m45s]EVO 2016 Grand finals Youtube[/url]
Plenty of offensive and defensive mechanics lead to a fast and varied gameplay that is both hectic and fun ! Fun, there's nothing else to describe it. 

Combat system allows for real self-expression. 
Characters have really different gameplays (coming from SF5, characters feel a lot more diversified). 
Movement is fast and has a strong air component with its air-dashing. No sitting around here like Street Fighter.
Optimal combos are lenghty (10skills/inputs) and never fall boring.
Lots of oki chars.
Keyframes are clear and consistent.
[url=http://www.dustloop.com/forums/index.php?/forums/topic/12529-ggxrd-input-lag-tests-results-pc-ps4-ps3/]One of best input lag <3f[/url]
There are tight tiers list (Sin/Johny being top), but every character is fun to play and feel special.
Real anti-air potential that leads to dmg (not like SF5).

[url=https://skygrindah.blogspot.be/2015/07/guilty-gear-xrd-usability-chart.html?m=1]Good ressource explainng all characters technicality and focus (link)[/url]
I can't list everything since I'm no master. What I can say however is that this system is [b]amazingly balanced. There is strong offense but there are plenty of defensive options[/b], this is really much more than footsies/neutral. Taking every aspect of it to its maximum potential is a real challenge.

To list some of them
[url]http://www.dustloop.com/wiki/index.php/Guilty_Gear_Xrd_-REVELATOR-[/url]
[u]Offensive[/u]
-Roman cancels : spend meter for instant timestop allowing to extend combos or special setup
-0f throws + airthrows for everyone
-RISC : harassing a blocking opponent will rise his RISC level, increasing incoming damage and potentially forcing a counter hit
-Clash : perfectly timed counter allowing for an instant combo on open component
-Unblockables : certain moves can't be blocked, hence can be used in tricky setups/okis
-Instant kills : more for a cool factor since they're not practical, leads into a anime sequence

[u]Defensive[/u]
-Dead angle attack : spend meter while blocking to knock-away the opponent (like V-reversal)
-Blitz shield : spend meter while blocking to attack opponent and put him in stagger state, open for combos. This can be countered on reaction by also spending meter.
-Instant block : timed blocking, lowers hitstun and slightly increases meter
-Faultless defense : spend a little meter while blocking. No chip dmg and RISC, more push-back/blockstun
-Burst : a separate type of meter that regens over time, work as a combo-breaker (can be blocked/whiffed). Starts full at R1 and carries to next rounds.
-Throw teching
-iframes on backstep

[u]Balancing[/u]
-GUTS : lower incoming dmg at lower HP
-Proration : certain moves leads to lower dmg scaling combos (fast move having lower scaling)
-Negative penalty : lose all meter if you don't move/attack. No turtling around !
-Hellfire : if at <20% HP, your specials will do more dmg

I've experienced with plenty of combat systems in all type of games be it Dark Souls, Black Desert / Tera MMORPG or the obvious fighting games.
This one is the best in my books, explaining why would take pages.

A touch on [b]difficulty and execution[/b]. The system isn't hard to understand. Take your time to go through the tutorial (which is the best period) and wiki and you'll get clear
explanations of the different mechanics. Optimal combos will have 10-15 inputs with plenty of charge moves and chaining. However you can get easily 80% dmg of a optimal combo with lower execution. A typical anti-air is 8 inputs. That doesn't make this game a hell of execution but it sets the bar high so you might want to do your daily fingering routine at the lab ! 
[b]Guilty Gear relies mostly on chaining[/b] which is easier timing and more flowing, contrary to Street Fighter linking.
Also the matchup knowledge is absolutely crucial since characters are so different.

[b]In fine : Medium difficulty to start. Very high bar on max potential. Harder to start than a Street Fighter 5 and harder to master.
But ! Don't swear by this system because it's hard, it is just the funniest and most satisfying to play.[/b]

[h1]Art[/h1]
Top-notch cel shading. Some would say one of the best on the market right now. 3D characters that retain the 2D feel whilst allowing for cinematics. 
Charadesign is perfect, diversified and inspired.
Same would go for backgrounds, but none of them really struck me compared to the perfect chars.
One thing that may split opinions : varied framerates elements. Post-effect is 60FPS, background/cinematics 30FPS, characters 24FPS with 12 keyframes (hand corrected).
There are clear design reasons why Arc went this way [url]https://youtu.be/yhGjCzxJV3E?t=33m57s[/url].
I like it except for specials cinematics (ie Elphelt Judge better half) where the 30FPS does feel off.

[h1]Audio[/h1]
[url=https://youtu.be/symCvnUCRwI]BGM are nothing short from perfect (Youtube link)[/url]. Mostly Metal style.
Japanese VA are perfect.
Some effects and mixing were sub-bar. I'm using a Asus Xonar Essence One and Sennheiser 650 so this might be a compatibility issue due to port.
I couldn't find those issues in Revelator so hopefully it will be fixed.

[h1]Netplay[/h1]
Clear frame lag display 
Average 120 players at a set time are on PC Sign compared to 1200 on SF5 PC(which has crossplay).
There is no crossplay.
Good netcode (better than SF5)
Random matching will be pretty inexistent, I'd recommend getting on the dedicated Guilty Gear Steam Groups and Discord to make some pals !
Start here [url]https://www.reddit.com/r/Guiltygear/[/url]
This being a old niche game (niche game of a niche gametype), you'll be mostly running in skilled players. So only get into this community with a good attitude as you should with every game !

[h1]Story and solo content[/h1]
4.5h of content which I did in one go and really enjoyed !
Real lore background, topnotch jap VA, good story for a fighting game with actual characters construction !
Technical is average : 75% visual novel style with 3D chars, 25% 3D cinematics with average environment.
Characters and their VA carried it mainly for me.
A worthy story mode compared to the insulting filler crap that Capcom came up with for SF5.
Arcade and mission mode (offers some nice variety)
Getting ingame credits is easy with all different modes.

[h1]PC port quality[/h1]
Max resolution 1080p (more if tweaking with GeDosato)
All good for the rest

[h1]Comparison with SF5[/h1]
I am Karin gold on Street Fighter 5 350h. SF is mainly fundamentals and footsies (which isn't bad), but GG makes for a more varied intresting and fun experience with more potential.
The first thing I noticed is how active defense could be. Street Fighter defense is guesswork only and leads to terrible negative edge if you think of the 8f input lag taking reaction partially out of the game.

Content in Guilty Gear is miles ahead.
Arc/Guilty Gear does better in every aspect and love what they do !
Arc really shows they care with their production where Capcom mainly feeds their fanbase with uninspired unfinished mediocrity at high price.

24837202.review:
Where the FUCK is Revelator, Arcsys?

I'll first day buy that shit just fucking release already.

I guess since I do reviews of stuff in a serious manner I might as well make this half-serious: game is good. The tiers are really, really close and tight to the point where no tier list is agreed upon, as opposed to SFV or KOF2002 whereby the tiers are pretty much set in stone. In other words: all the characters in this game are viable and no one is truly bottom tier (other than Potemkin and Slayer). This game is incredibly well-balanced, which it should be since these characters (minus the new ones) have been getting honed and worked on for close to a decade. Which makes me wonder why the SF characters that have been there since II aren't as balanced and close in terms of tier strength and viability.

There are no clone characters. Every character is unique and your skills with that person doesn't carry over to the other, precisely because they are so unique. The point is better accentuated through contrast: Gouken, Dee Jay, Ryu, Sakura, Dan, Akuma, and Sean are all different characters (with different placement on tier lists). But in many ways they are simply different takes on the same formula: they all have roughly the same inputs for specials and their differences are just that their Dp's and Tatsus are different takes on the same move. It's variations of the same principle; they are all shotos. 

GG on the other hand has much more variety in characters and your skills with one won't carry over to another. Some characters have their own unique ''gimmicks'', like Sin's hunger gauge that depletes with every special used but, conversely powers up specials the fuller it is. Venom has pool balls he sets on stage he can teleport to, and all his moves launch them in different trajectories, angles hit also matter. Or Johnnys limited coins for a bout that-oh wait that's in Revelator WHERE THE FU*K IS REVELATOR ARCSYS.

The point is that because the characters are much more varied and different than SF's roster you have to dedicate yourself more to each individual character to truly master them. It took me 70 hours to get a grip on Axl and all the matchups he has; in 100 hours I mained around 8 different characters in SFIV. Granted I'm also much better at GG than SFIV so take that however you wish.

Because each character has their own unique playstyle that doesn't really carry over to any other character your matchup in GG matters more and the manner in which you approach people may drastically change. Against a Venom I know he has projectiles all over the map that hit my hurtboxes, so I rushdown and use my long range normals much more carefully and less frequently (which is REALLY FUC*ING WEIRD FOR AXL); against a KY I make use of my Rensen a lot more just as a pressure tool and don't follow up; against Sol I mind the flames on the floor and am careful with my chains since they have hurtboxes his DP can stuff. Like any fighter your general technique is the same but because there's more variety here in the roster and playstyles you'll find yourself playing much differently depending on the matchup.

I'll end the SF comparison by saying this: FUCK 50/50's. There's none of that bullsh*t ''will he grab or dp on my wakeup'' that some characters in SF have, and thank GOD cause if it's a literal guessing game then eff that.

What there IS here is an EXTREME emphasis on okizeme and mixups/rushdown. This might as well be called, ''okizeme: The Fighting Game''. For those unfamiliar: oki just means your tactics on the enemies wakeup. So after a hard knockdown, what comes next? That's when your pressure game and your mixups come into play; your oki game. This game has a larger emphasis on hard knockdowns and pressure than any other. What this means is that if you're new at this you're gonna get perfected 10 times over; if this game teaches ANYTHING it's how to EFFIN BLOCK.

But if you think turtling all game is great; it's not. Your super gauge (called tension in this game) is completed depleted if you're just holding back all the time. You're penalized for turtling by having your entire gauge erased and by taking even MORE damage from the next hit that connects and isn't blocked. 

So not only does this game want you to learn how to block, but it also wants you to do as little of that as possible and to look for holes in offense and counter attack. This makes for fights as hype as MvsC3 fights, except without the touch of death combos due to perforation (reduced damage as the combo continues) and the myriad of defensive options this game has.

You can parry for 1/4'th your tension gauge. You can have your tension gauge slowly deplete if you activate Just Defense, which negates all chip damage. You have Dead Angle Attack, which is essentially a dp for half your gauge (usefulness varies by character). And you can Instant Defend, which builds up tension as you block, by blocking at the proper timing (think of it as SFIII parries, except you press back). There's also Burst, which can be used offensively or defensively. It builds slowly over a match; faster if you're taking damage, but you start with it full at each fights start. Your character jumps up negating all hit or block stun and lets our a burst, hitting your opponent. This can be used to get out of pressure or offensively to gain 100% tension. Whether you need tension more than the defensive option it provides depends on matchup and how confident you feel.

Finally there's roman cancels. You have three roman cancels, which use different amounts of tension but all do the same thing: cancel what you're doing right away. It's SFIV's FADC; only more intuitive and much more central to play. You can do X and roman cancel; you can stand still and roman cancel; you can roman cancel the recovery, but it all costs tension. Depending on the matchup and your character you may need to roman cancel your approach with a projectile of some sort, or you may do a mixup and roman cancel for a continuation. Axl, for example, has a command grab that has range; you can roman cancel it on the enemie's wakeup when they jump to use your anti air chains, so you're essentially doing an unblockable if timed right. But the enemy can jump and roman cancel in the air (roman cancels slow down time slightly), and dash forward with the extra time gained.

So roman cancels are central and can lead to mind games, as well as the creation of space and some cheeky cheeky cheeky plays. In many cases your tension is better put to use with roman cancels rather than supers, although some characters have really good supers that can be used as reversals and are useful in particular matchups (ramlethal can use hers to close the gap with Axl and get up close for a hard knockdown, but she doesn't need it against, say, a Sol). 

it's a fantastic anime fighter with a lot of depth to it that makes it fast, hype, but also deep and tactical. It's like MvsC3 or Skullgirls but fast and with a lot of tools and complexity. The online is still alive; albeit GG is nowhere near as popular as the mainstream fighter (since there's really only one) Street Fighter. Mainly because it's much harder to get into any individual character and generally more complex in...everything. 

Oh and it brings a 6 hour movie. GG has an assload of lore and story to it that I keep telling myself I'm gonna get into but never do. The music is also incredible, the presentation is fantastic, the designs and art are great. It's pretty much the best anime fighter and, in my opinion, 2D fighter on the market at the moment. Now WHERE THE FUC* IS REVELATOR I WANNA PLAY JOHNNY ALREADY.

今作で追加されたエルフェルト=ヴァレンタインは
攻撃力も高く、防御力も高く、コンボ性能も高く、牽制技も強く、更にガード不能連携技も使え、ゲージ増加率も高い狂ったキャラだ
コマ投げからコンボで一撃技に繋がるロマンもあるし専用BGMも素晴らしい、そして可愛いと言う事なしの良キャラだ

女性キャラは基本的に体力が低めに設定されてるので下手すると2,3回コンボを受けると死んでしまうのに対し
エルフェルトは愛されボディでそこそこ耐えてくれる

使いこなせれば端で使い続けるだけで一方的に嬲り殺す事が出来るだろう。

デメリットはこのキャラに嫌悪感を抱いている人が少なからず居ると言う事
自分はこのキャラを使ってから6人程対戦拒否をされてしまった

21時~2時以外はランクマ・プレマ共に満足に対戦できる環境とは言い難い
加えてランクマッチは初段以上に上がると同ランクプラスマイナス2段までしか検索表示されない為、満足に対戦できる環境とは言い難い
同じ人と対戦が多い為、自ずと連コする形になってしまうため、対戦拒否が起こりやすくなる原因とも言える

とは言え、”対戦ゲーム”なのだから上記の時間対にプレイが厳しい人はお勧めしにくいのも事実で
ランク差が激しいと一方的に嬲られる事が多いゲームなので
プレイヤー数のパイが少ない現状、そういったことが起こりやすいのも事実である
