24669131.review:
I'll keep this review short, as I lack the technical competence to properly judge a fighting game. While I have enjoyed them (and keep enjoying them) since my childhood (Street Fighter 2 being my first entry in the genre), I am definitely just a casual to this day.

With this being said, I believe this is the kind of game that both casuals and more hardcore players can enjoy. The combat is responsive, fluid and enjoyable, the cast of characters is well known by now, but even after all these years it remains a varied and interesting group, and the new entries here and there are enough to freshen things up.

The graphics are marvelous, I can't believe these are 3d models, and the style remains faithful to previous entries in the series. The soundtrack is also amazing, and deserves praise. The story is... Let's say anime bullshit? It's kind of fun, as long as you don't think too hard about it (the anime movie that is essentially the story mode is well coreographed and has good direction, though, even if the plot is what it is). 

I got this game as a gift, and it has been one of the best gifts ever so far! ^_^ Definitely worth it if you are interested into fighting games (maybe avoid the online scene if you aren't truly dedicated, though, as I assume the players are going to be very competitive, and this is definitely faster and less forgiving than, say, Street Fighter 4, for the uninitiated, and the smaller user base probably makes it even harder to find people of lower skill level).

24495872.review:
Follow up to one of the greatest 2D fighting games of all time, Guilty Gear Xrd doesn't disappoint. With full 3D animations modified with intentional frame lag to resemble sprites, the game's artistic style is god like. Combine intense visuals with the games rocking soundtrack and also access to classic songs from previous games, Xrd respects its past while adding a whole new soundtrack to the series. As a fan of the series, I was disappointed with the smaller roster, however they will be adding more characters in the Revelator expansion. This game delivers on so many levels, and respects classic fans to the series while also establishing as a more stylized and ultimately different Guilty Gear experience, but one that leaves little if anything to complain about. I don't bother with network fighting games usually, so I can't comment on that.

~IGN: 10/10, would get uppercutted by Slayer and read randomly generated haikus again

23743545.review: I will update a review later, as I have always loved the GG series, and was looking forward to this, for now it gets a tanked rating mainly because of the consistant complaints of controller issues and the simple fact the Steam controller in game isn't recognized at all and isn't working except as a mouse and keyboard input rather than as an actual controller, Unreal engine has had issues with controller support especially with fighting games and it seems this game is neck deep with problems in that line.  The game looks good, Voice acting is over the top godaweful but that is almost always standard fare for an anime related game let alone an anime itself. My only wish would be that the story mode is less played out as an actual visual novel and more like an actual anime fully animated instead of story boarded at least what little I have seen of it, as like BlazeBlu it eventually becomes a who cares button mash just to get through the awkward dialog play outs, while it has its charm it isn't a Clannad or Stiens Gate/ Chaos Head deep type of story, and for an anime, well, thats terribad, as most anime is defined by a deep story and the way its story unfolds. Music is always amaing from Arc but to be blunt if they want the higher end sales, it doesn't mater how good the fighting on a technical scale the game is, it just needs to work properly. Arc is getting better at PC ports, but they are still in that old capcom bad PC port era, and like I said if they want the PC crowd they need to do better and whine less about sales when the games clearly have issues.

22932477.review:
As someone who already owns the PS4 version as well I have to say I really like the porting they did on PC. While the Online mode has slightly less features (but nothing compromising) what I like that the PC is actually faster in terms of input lag (only 1 frame of input lag compared to the 4 of the PS4 version). Now this does not make the PC versione Arcade Perfect, HOWEVER it is absolutely a good thing if you plan to play this game online as the game being faster will make the online matches feel like the offline coin-op version of the game.

Unless you are blessed with an active local scene or a group of friends that you can play with offline (for which I would recommend sticking to the PS4 version in that case), if you spend the majority of the time playing online then the PC version absolutely takes the cake.

22485402.review:
Guilty Gear Xrd is essentially a huge step up from other 2D fighters that were ported to the PC. It has little to no bugs especially with arcsys working hard to fix the game often. For a game not originally made with a PC port it's got pretty good online play albeit it still needs improvements. 

Pros:
To start off with what GGXrd does right is that for a game that was originally for PS3/PS4, it runs just as, if not even better on PC. No real input delay, and is even supported by a diverse amount of controllers (keyboard included). Although it should be noted that the controller needs to be plugged in before you start the game otherwise the game will only recognize the keyboard inputs. 
Graphicswise it looks and performs better than the PS3/PS4 version (as long as you have a graphics card better than the standard Intel card). However, the game can still even run around 50-60 fps on the Intel graphics if you turn down the settings. Don't expect it to look pretty though. The game itself runs on Unreal Engine 3 which was originally intended for Windows.
Also, the online lobby system is one of the best I've seen. It has 8 player lobbies, with 4 battle rooms for those players to interact. So it doesn't just come down to 8 players with 2 fighting while 6 spectate. You have full control of your player icon to move around the rooms and switch what battle room you want to participate in. Whether you want to play winner next in line or just spectate. There's even an AFK section for players who haven't pressed a button in awhile so people don't get stuck on empty battle rooms.

The character cast itself is really well done for a fighting game. Very diverse and stylish character designs. And the characters themselves offer playstyles suited for almost everyone. Starting from simple straightforward characters like Sol Badguy and Ky Kiske, to zoners like Axl, and for the people who like playing two characters at once there's Zato-1.

Cons:
This is not really a problem I've come across with the PS3/PS4 version. However, it's worth mentioning because people are bound to come across this issue. Like I mentioned previously, the online play itself works fine. Connecting into player lobbies is mostly consistent especially if you're playing with someone in the same region. Playing with someone far away can cause input delay, which can even reach to 10-14 frame delay which is almost unplayable. In my experience, I've tried playing with people on the other side of the world and sometimes had 4 ms delay so it can work sometimes far away. The biggest problem with GGXrd on the PC port is that there's problems connecting to people, especially with ranked mode. And also if you're playing on strict NAT you won't be able to connect to people at all. Which can be a problem for colleges specifically as most run on strict NAT.

Overall rating - 7.5/10
It's a great fighting game, and a must buy for arcsys fans especially if you're a Blazblue player. Would rate higher if not for it's issues with the online function that I touched upon. Although, arcsys has been dishing out patches continuously to better improve the online as well as other bugs. 

With the sequel "GGXrd Revelator" rolling around the corner in just a couple of months, this is a great opportunity for new players to give this game a shot.

22484825.review:
After a Dozen Years comes now the next new Installment of Guilty Gear.

Developed with the Unreal Engine 3, the Game features now real 3D Chars (No HD Sprites) alongside some few Cinematics during Play which gives the Feel of Immersive 3D. The Game itself is still played in 2D (Arenas are tough 3D Maps with Impression giving 2D).

You can choose over 16 Characters (some New alongside some Old Ones) each with his own Challenge Course for learning BnB Combos. The Story Mode is now a Movie (estimated 4 hours) without some Interaction, so you can sit back and press only the Text Screens away during Talking between Characters.

For Singleplayer there is not much Content: M.O.M, Arcade, Story Mode, Challenges and Missions (BlazBlue in Comparison offers in that Regard more Gameplay for Singleplayer)

Network is like in BB by opening Lobbys for People to gather. As Host you have Options kicking out unwanted Guests or announcing disclosure of Room (Useful for a better Closure while others are finishing their Matches)

Here are some of my +/ o / - Points:

Positive:
- 1080p Support for gorgeous looking Fights
- 16 Chars to choose from which isnt that few since its newly developed
- Roman Cancel Mechanic was remade, so that FRC is possible for everyone (in GGXX FRC were limited and difficult to perform for Beginners (Hit FRC at 1/15 of a Second in a Frame!))
- M.O.M has more Depth than in GGXX (Comparable like the Abyss Mode in BB)
- Network Code is much better and has automatic Delay (GGXX AC+R used static Delay if i recall correctly)
- Videos in Story Mode gives you some Anime Feeling and is good to watch (Could also turn in a full fledget Anime IMHO)
- New Mechanics like Blitzshield for Counterattacking, etc.
- Connection and FPS Counter for Network Mode gives you good Infos if Match is possible
- Hellfire Mechanic (Higher Damage, etc.) gives you Motivation to continue when you reach Critical Health before loosing.

Neutral:
- Danger Time Mechanic can be annoying depending how you see it (20% more Damage if you get hit while being in Mortal Counter State with nearly no Teching!)
- Some Old Chars have gained/losed more Moves than other (Example: Axl/Ky getting better Moves, Slayer being ripped off of some vital Moves from AC+R, etc.)
- New Roman Cancel Mechanic and other Adjustements may be a Turn Down for Veterans from GGXX. Xrd has a more "casual" feeling to avoid a too high learning curve for Beginners

Negative:
- Low Content for Singleplayer
- No Survival Mode in Xrd
- Huge Damage Scaling. Some Combos can reduce nearly 3/4 of your Health Bar in one Combo Chain!!!
- OP DLC Chars in my Eyes (DLC Chars (Leo, Elphelt & Sin) have (very) high damage output)
Note: Sin/Elphelt got nerfed strongly in Revelator, which shows how unbalanced they are in Sign
- Few Old Chars nerfed strongly in Xrd (Slayer and Potemkin from Top Tier to Low Tier in Xrd)
- Rarely Bug: After committing to a Match, you get thrown out because Connection wasn't possible

Fazit:
I can wholeheartly recommend this Game for GG Fans and Newcomers. 
Since the new Revision "Rev2" is also on Steam, i recommend switching over there since this Game is would be "dead" online

22280787.review: В этой игре можно отлично провести время, сражаясь с друзьями. Только не рассчитывайте поиграть в онлайне. Во-первых, в онлайне играет очень мало народа. По крайней мере, у меня (с ДВ) находит две комнаты - одна в США, другая у национальности, использующей иероглифы для письма. И даже если сессия не прервется, как обычно бывает, вы не сможете сделать даже пару ударов до окончания раунда. Любое мастерство, которое помогало в бою с другом, в сети не действует. Здесь люди (особенно азиаты) играют так, что победить невозможно даже случайно. Супер-комбо, снимающие почти 100 процентов хп и от которых нельзя защититься - вот и весь бой. Так что лучше не тратье нервы и не суйтесь в онлайн, если вы не можете нажимать несколько кнопок в секунду или не играли в эту игру одним персом хотя бы полгода. -Runs smoothly for me , right at the 60 fps

Cons:

-Certain problems with netcodes.

See you next time on Revelator !

22219775.review:
C'est mon Guilty Gear préféré, car il surpasse de beaucoup Guilty Gear Isuka, Guilty Gear X2 #Reload et Guilty Gear XX Accent Core Plus.

1. Il est possible de configurer sa manette XBOX facilement.
2. Il y a des images, musiques etc, à déverrouiller.
3. Des voix anglaises pour les personnages. (Enfin!)
4. Un superbe Mode Histoire, mais il n'y a aucun combat, juste un mélange de scènes aminés et d’Histoire Visuelle.
5. Le Mode Arcade est tout aussi génial. Toutes les scènes animées de ce mode varient selon la couleur des costumes/cheveux de notre personnage!
6. La possibilité d'avoir les voix de tous les persos en tant qu'annonceurs.

Dommage que certains persos des autres jeux sont absents, dus au scénario. J'aurais bien voulu me battre avec Dizzy et Bridget... (Quoi que Dizzy a un petit moment dans le mode Histoire.) Enfin, recommandée.

22204997.review:
It's a shame that there's really so little to say when a fighting game does everything right. Words like "satisfying" sound a little trite and hollow considering the tremendous effort that goes into a fighter that delivers what you expect from a worthy entry to the genre. Guilty Gear Xrd is, quite simply, one of the best fighters out there right now, let alone one of the best fighters available on this distribution platform. As you'd expect from this series, the visuals are gorgeous, the sound is killer, the community is decent, and the basic mechanics are easy enough for a novice to pick up and enjoy. The Tutorial and Mission modes in this game are an outstanding introduction to Xrd's new elements (For those of us who need to be broken of the bad habits we picked up in AC) as well as a great platform for newcomers to improve not only in this game, but fighting games in general. If you're one of those guys that cut your teeth on #Reload's multiplayer, you'll be at home in rather short order.

That said, it's not perfect. The character roster is disappointingly lean, and the learning curve for a considerable number of those characters available is startlingly high. The multiplayer interface is unintuitive garbage, and in general, too much of Xrd's metagame takes place in corners for my liking. I personally still prefer AC+R for these reasons, but not by a significant enough margin to abandon either game. Get Xrd, play the Tutorial, jump in, and I think you'll have a good time.

唔...這遊戲的故事劇情出奇的有張力唉，角色表現也很豐滿，聲優表現更是棒極了，不論是人生勝利組的凱，還是富爹+干爹流的辛恩，都擁有著出色的人設與劇情演出，更別說是系列主角的索爾了，專橫卻十分理智，急燥卻能夠自制。

明明心地很好，卻常用粗暴的態度應對別人，怕別人被失控的自己傷害到。看來粗枝大葉，卻在一些小細節處十分敏銳，整體來說是個十分有魅力的角色，拉格納跟索爾一比，簡直是不諳世事的小屁孩，除了專職吐槽役，幾乎沒有任何的可比性，果然男子漢還是要像索爾這樣的大老粗來擔當才行唷~!

女性角色們也很有魅力，不論是女子力up、up愛爾菲特，還是表面三無實際上很怕寂寞的拉姆蕾薩爾，都十分的具有萌力，較有印象的就是愛爾菲特起床羞恥度滿分的夢囈語，還有拉姆蕾薩爾那句"我也是不同的嗎?"讓人有些小感動!!

總之這是個格鬥遊戲性上乘，而劇情故事也十分有張力的好作品，以前咱只玩過日文版的ggxx，玩遊戲只知道打打殺殺，沒想到這作品的劇情也是如此優秀，在此推薦給各位劇情向、格鬥向遊戲的愛好者，以上~!!

ps：從劇情的發展模式看來，辛恩似乎比他的老爸更有女性魅力，未來可望左擁右抱人氣角色姐妹花，好船預感...

昔、ゲームセンターで賑わっていた
GUILTY GEARの新作。PS3版もプレイ済みです。
噂ではキャラの権利関係でゴタゴタして
ブレイブルーに跡目を譲ったそうですが
ようやく復活の目処が立ったようです。
Xbox360で発売されていたGUILTY GEAR2のキャラも登場。
日本語に対応しています。


今作からアニメ調の3Dになりましたが、
基本的な操作や感覚は昔の2Dと同じで
青リロなどをやりこんでいた世代なら
同じ立ち回りである程度戦えると思います。
新システムで黄・紫ロマンキャンセルや
ダストアタックの仕様変更など新作らしい
様々な変化があり、
新作ならではの立ち回りも研究出来ます。

逆に初心者は元々複雑だったシステムに
さらに項目が増えたので
昔以上に取っ付きにくくなった印象はあります。


昔のGG好きに是非ともお勧めしたい内容ですが、
個人(懐古)的な不満も割と多い作品です。

今までは全キャラに固有のストーリーが用意されていましたが、
今作のストーリーモードは完全に一つだけです。

※内容について　ネタバレ有り
[spoiler]一つの話に無理矢理全キャラを出そうとしている為、
殆どの過去キャラがゴミの様な扱いをされて退場していきます。
そしてポッと出の美男美女がｷｬｯｷｬｳﾌﾌする内容(しかも正史)なので
全員に独自のストーリーがあり、
一人一人が主役だと思っていた身としては
凸(´･ω･`)ﾌｧｯｷｭｰと言わざるを得ませんでした。
ただこれは思い出補正があるので、
過去作に触れていない人だと、評価がまた違うかもしれません。

最近のJRPGでも多い全力でボスを倒しても
「ﾌﾌﾌ予定通りだ」「これから○○を実行する！」
と手の平で踊っていた展開で
達成感のない区切りのつかないオチなのも食傷気味でした。[/spoiler]

あと個人的に新キャラ達がブレイブルー寄りで
あまりギルティギアらしくない気がしました。
GGX→頭にウーロン缶をつけた中華娘・裸日本人・死語を好むナルシスト・(<◎>)ﾌｫｫｫｫ
GGXX→シスター風の美少女(実は野郎)・貞子憑きの婚活青年・
スネオヘアーのマッハ吸血鬼・椎名○檎
その他　全身傷だらけで鍵と結婚しているホムンクルスなど
頭の片隅に残る様な変態が多かったですが、
今回の新キャラはベッドマン以外、パワー不足な気がします。
ベッドマンもスト4のルーファスを見慣れた直前だと･･･

ゲームバランスについてはいつも通りなので割愛。
GGの中では、割と良い部類だと思います。

総合的な感想としては、対戦ツールとしては
ギルティギアをやりこんでいた人には有りだと思います。
今から始める人は、グラフィックや演出を楽しむ目的でなら有りだと思いますが
昔やりこんでいた人や現役組と戦って勝つのは
相当の根気がいるでしょう。
初心者と上級者の力差が
他の格闘ゲームの何倍も出るゲーム性だと思います。

21860987.review:
this is one of the best fighting game ports/versions to hit PC. Right off, Guilty Gear is fucking METAL, the volume is at base just louder which is an odd thing to think about or notice but its funny/awesome/welcome.

Gameplay is smooth and just like the earlier games insofar as attacks and combos are concerned, but the fresh system takes out all the particulars that started to plague later games in terms of balance.

Graphics aren't usually a thing it talk about as an essential thing, and while i'm not saying this is cryteck shit, but its a better looking game than so many others on the market. the choice to make it cell shaded is amazing and even the animation to the game is made to mimic the older 2D games, which this does wonderfully. the game is speedy as well much like a 2D game despite it being 3d models.

Stylistically Guilty Gear Xrd is far above whats out here in the AAA range but also a great addition to the series and welcome to the fighting game community. Get it and start kicking ass.

21769775.review:
Moi. Hier. 20h30.
"Bon, c'est bien sympa, ce mode story, mais comme il ne s'agit que de lire et de regarder les bonzhommes bouger à l'écran, je vais m'envoyer un ou deux chapitres tous les soirs et en une semaine, hop là, c'est plié".

Moi. Hier. 21h30.
"Bon, allez, encore un petit, et je passe à autre chose".

Moi. Hier. 22h30.
"Au point où j'en suis, je peux bien aller jusqu'au bout".

Moi. Hier. 23h30.
"Au point où j'en suis, je VEUX bien aller jusqu'au bout".

Moi. Ce matin. 0h30.
"OH MY GOD ! OH MY GOD ! OH MY GOD ! EN FAIT ILS VOULAIENT [ SPOILER ] DEPUIS LE DEBUT ! ET POUR CA ILS ONT [ SPOILER ] ! OH MAIS NON, PAS POSSIBLE ! [ SPOILERS ] et [ SPOILERS ] côte-à-côte ! JE... JE... KYAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA !
<3 <3 <3"

Moi. Ce matin. Une heure du mat'.
"Mes yeux. Mes yeux. Jamais j'arriverais à dormir. Et-je-m'en-fous !".

Ah ça, on m'a entendu râler, pester, jurer, tempêter, comme quoi "l'animation japonaise, c'était mieux avant". On m'a rétorqué que je n'étais pas objectif, que c'était juste la nostalgie qui parlait par ma bouche et à force, j'avoue, j'ai douté, j'ai même failli y croire...

Et puis Guilty Gear Xrd est tombé du ciel, ou pas loin, pour m'annoncer de sa voix de stentor : "there will be no more delay".

Parce qu'autant ne pas tourner davantage autour du pot, aussi ininteractif soit-il, son story mode colle une sévère branlée en mode "instant kill" à cinq ou six ans d'otakisme formaté par des tacherons pour des foules trépanées au Moe.

Oui, ça parle beaucoup, et parfois trop.
Oui, c'est très statique, ce n'est pas une série TV (hélas).
Mais fichtre de fourche, quel style, quelle fougue, quelle claque !
C'est dense, c'est complexe, c'est habile, c'est intelligent, ça rebondit sans cesse en empruntant discrètement à Philip K. Dick (Blade Runner et Siva, excusez du peu), Full Metal Alchemist, Evangelion, Doctor Who et même au premier Patlabor d'Oshii, au point de ne plus avoir à rougir face à un Xenogears qu'il tutoie sans effort.
Et si la galerie de personnages n'évite pas certains clichés propres à la japanimation, à aucun moment, ceux-ci ne sont une entrave ou une faiblesse, au contraire : employés comme ils le sont, ils deviennent de solides atouts - sans compter que le casting est si riche qu'on pardonne aisément que certains visages soient laissés à l'arrière-plan (comment faire autrement ?).

Depuis 1998, que l'intrigue dure, rendez-vous compte. Presque vingt ans qu'elle s'étire, qu'elle s'enrichit à chaque nouvel épisode, se dévoile pièce par pièce, livre son puzzle morceau par morceau pour n'amener, à chaque réponse, que plus de questions passionnantes, relancer sans cesse la machine à coups de cliffhangers habiles et bien pensés. Sans s'essouffler, bien au contraire. Prenant toujours plus d'ampleur, ouvrant toujours plus de perspectives.

Pour preuve : alors que cet épisode, enfin, livre les réponses aux interrogations posées par les opus PS2 (qui m'auront longuement occupé en leur temps), alors qu'il reconstitue le tableau d'une façon explicite à laquelle la licence ne nous a pas habitué, comme annonçant un dénouement, une ultime menace, révélant les vrais antagonistes qui conspiraient dans l'ombre depuis le commencement, il arrive encore à transcender son matériau originel pour rebondir encore, et encore, et encore, et l'étoffer d'autant, sans que jamais cela ne semble artificiel ou trop forcé, comme si tout avait été pensé depuis le premier épisode - ce qui n'est pas un mince exploit scénaristique, Nomura et Nojima en savent quelque chose.

Au-delà, comment ne pas être sensible à l'amour paternel du scénariste pour ses personnages, qui transparaît un peu plus à chaque scène, à chaque confrontation ? !
Quelle générosité, dans la façon dont il les place chacun leur tour sous le feu des projecteurs !
Combien de morceaux de bravoure, aussi, pour contenter les fans, qui crieront comme des midinettes devant certaines réunions contre-nature, ou certaines séquences à couper le souffle.

Le tout, servi par un soundtrack symphonique dans la droite ligne d'un Pirates des Caraïbes, mais catapulté hors de la stratosphère, agrémenté de quelques morceaux rocks survoltés toujours utilisés à bon escient.

On sourit, on vibre, on retient sa p'tite larmichette.
Les révélations pleuvent.
De nouvelles questions se soulèvent.
Et alors qu'on se croit sur le point de tourner une page, à nouveau, on réalise qu'on s'est bien fait avoir et qu'au fond, ce qui précédait n'était qu'un long prologue. Les véritables enjeux sont ailleurs. Les véritables joueurs de cette partie d'échec n'ont pas encore sorti le grand jeu.

Guilty Gear aurait été une série TV qu'elle aurait eu de quoi alimenter plus de cent épisodes sans même se reposer sur les combats, et qu'elle aurait ridiculisé les neuf dixièmes des titres qui sortent actuellement, y compris les grosses machines à buzz comme Kill la Kill ou l'Attaque des Titans.

Et de loin.

Daisuke Ishiwatari, le scénariste, est tellement bon dans ce domaine que c'en est insolent.
Vraiment.
Il maîtrise le propos, les ficelles, l'art et la manière et joue de sa licence comme de sa guitare : en virtuose.

Oui, absolument, c'est comme ça qu'on écrit.
Oui, absolument, c'est comme ça qu'on construit une intrigue.
Oui, absolument, c'est comme ça qu'on la met en valeur.
N'en déplaise à la clique des wannabees scénaristes adoubés par les partisans de la Dramaturgie, qui ne produiront jamais l'ombre de l'ombre d'un tel travail.

Oublions les Tetsuya Nomura (toujours lui) et les Hideo Kojima, ou fauchons-les de leur piédestal pas-toujours-très-mérité. Ishiwatari les surclasse, sans la prétention.
Y'a-t-il quelque chose qu'il ne sache pas faire, d'ailleurs ?

Il compose ses soundtracks avec un sens du riff vertigineux, écrit avec une précision d'orfèvre, scénarise à la perfection, dessine comme un dieu (les personnages, c'est lui aussi), va jusqu'à doubler son protagoniste, met en scène, gère les storyboards, crée les mécaniques du jeu, et parvient aujourd'hui encore à progresser, à placer la barre toujours plus haut, vers l'infini et au-delà.

N'aurait-il pas fondé Arc System Works, aurait-il eu le moyen de laisser ainsi son talent s'exprimer avec une telle pureté, un tel jusqu'au-boutisme ?
Est-ce là le prix qu'il faut payer pour rester un vrai créateur, et produire de la qualité, dans notre monde sclérosé par le prêt à rapporter ?
Mérite-t-il, pareillement, le quasi-anonymat qui l'entoure, alors qu'il représente l'une des figures les plus inspirées et les plus inspirantes de la pop-culture du moment ?

Guilty Gear Xrd est un excellent jeu de combat : nerveux, accessible, technique, addictif, visuellement et musicalement magnifique mais franchement, de vous à moi, j'aurais pu me contenter de ce mode story et ne pas me sentir volé.

Tant pis si je n'ai pas touché la manette pendant quatre heures.
Je n'ai qu'une hâte : pouvoir investir dans le prochain opus, pour reprendre le fil de l'intrigue où il s'est brisé net.
Une fois de plus, sur une victoire qui n'en était pas une.
Tant pis si mon ordi ne parvient pas à faire tourner le jeu : une fois encore, j'en suis certain, l'histoire suffira amplement.

Heaven or Hell... Let's Rock !

21677065.review: At first I did not like the game because it seemed to cater more to those fighting game aficionados with nuclear reactor computers. The game is one's proverbial 2D fighter, where ea ch character has their own unique play style, combos do not have to be done in a 1-frame link sequence and the presentation of the characters and environment are well presented. 21676238.review:
Arc System Works воистину создали шедевр. А порт на PC получился просто идеальным - в это хочется играть и играть.
Но надо было родиться в другой стране, так как в нашей в компании друзей скорее запустят какой-нибудь МК под пивко, чем качественный и продуманный файтинг.
Ностальгические персонажи, знакомые по прошлым частям Guilty Gear.
Тонны драйва в бою, благодаря дополненной многими интересными фичами боевой системе.
Отличный онлайн-коннект - я замечательно играл с людьми из любых уголков России даже при том, что писали у них плохую скорость.
Красочная cel-shading графика, созданная на движке Unreal Engine 3, которая без тормозов тянется на макс настройках на системах года так 2010-го.
Отличный саундтрек, которым из раза в раз нас радуют игры этой серии.
Захватывающий сюжет, в котором проливается свет на многие вещи, лёгшие в основу происходящих в игре событий.
Истинное удовольствие для ценителей, так могу сказать.
Очень советую приобрести и поиграть.
Единственная проблема у игры - она слишком хороша. Я не вижу путей для её дальнейшего развития, кроме как добавления новых/старых персонажей и допиливания сюжета. Боёвку уже лучше не придумать, она и так превосходна. Вот бы игре побольше популярности, чтобы по ней активнее устраивали всякие состязания, было бы здорово.

21520976.review:
自SF3.3于GGXXAC问世以来，2D格斗游戏小众化的趋势愈演愈烈。高强度的竞技性与娱乐性在这个平台似乎水火不容，弱肉强食的环境让一批又一批的新手挫败并放弃格斗游戏。

近些年Blazblue与skullgirl这样对新手温和的游戏培养了如同我这样一批又一批的玩家来进入这个平台。虽说天天被老司机们摁在地上大力的摩擦，偶尔也能品味到刻苦的训练之后翻盘的快感。这种徘徊于摩擦与被摩擦之间的感觉，对我来说就是格斗游戏的魅力所在。

XRD可以说在老司机与新手之间找到了平衡点。如果你有同类格斗游戏的经验并觉得自己是个战士，那么这个游戏很适合你，保证你玩了之后再玩其他同类的游戏很难找到G点。如果你是AC#R的老司机，那么请你手下留情毕竟我只想虐菜。

21330408.review:
-Intro:
I am just going to get it out of the way; Guilty Gear is the king of airdashers, or anime fighters. The first Guilty Gear on the PS1 is the one that started the madness of jump blocking, clashing, dashing through the air, and instantly killing the opponent in a fun anime fashion. I got into the series recently after watching the Guilty Gear XRD Top 8 at Evo. There were many amazing moments, and some shameful upsets, (I am looking at you, Woshige), so I was instantly hooked. I had the delight of starting from the beginning with an emulator and experiencing the series' growth. I worked my way up through Guilty Gear X, XX, Accent Core, and now we are here, (I am sorry that I didn't play you, Overture). 

-Graphics:
Guilty Gear XRD is the revival of the series after ages of experimenting and releasing revisions of XX, and boy, it delivers. How much? Enough for it to be my favorite fighting game of all time. Enthusiasts say that fighting games are all about gameplay, but I cannot ignore what this game does with its graphics even in my horrid CRT monitor and bad system specs. The game looks like a drawn anime, but the catch is that it's actually rendered in full 3D with cel-shading that makes it look like an anime. You can see glimpses of this everytime you perform Dust attacks (Which are basically full-screen launchers), when you perform Overdrives, when the round is over, and with Instant Kills. The Instant Kills are pretty hard to hit, so they aren't broken; they are pretty damn rewarding tho, and I always compared them to Mortal Kombat fatalities as they get easier to use when the enemy is about to lose the match. Everything in this game is gorgeous and full of personality, however, the framerate on model animations is pretty jaggy, (Apparently because they wanted to make it similar to the animation of anime).

During the following paragraphs I will go over all the new mechanics that the game has, so if you are not interested in reading that technobabble you can skip to the content section:

-Mechanics:
XRD revamps the Roman Cancel system, as XX's was kinda unreliable with its forced roman cancels. RC's cancel attacks and slow down time significantly, giving you time to use them effectively. Now Roman Cancels are divided into three versions, Red, Yellow, and Purple. Red RC's are used when linked after an attack that hits the opponent and can extend combos, but they cost half of your Tension bar (The bar used for Overdrives), they are often better than overdrives because they are already hit confirmed and are usually friendlier for hit scaling. Yellow RC's are used after an attack that doesn't hit the opponent yet or at all; they cost 25% of the bar, so you can use them often to cancel out of punishable moves and slow down time like a vampire. You don't want to use Purple RC's, as they are just like the Yellow ones but cost 50% bar, they happen when you are late to do a YRC. There are many other new mechanics, like the Blitz Shield, which is a parry that leaves the opponent open to combos (It costs 25% of the gauge, but you usually get 12.5% back from the combo, so it's very good), and the R.I.S.C. Gauge, which punishes overly defensive play with forced counter attacks and stun.

The best thing about this game is that there isn't just multiple variables to everything, such as the above uses of RC's, the two uses for the Burst attack (One to get out of combos and the other to attack and get a full bar of tension), and the R.I.S.C gauge decreasing with hits as a secondary hit scaling, but additionally, there is an answer for everything as well, such as Bursts being thrown, Blitz Shield follow-ups being Blitz Shielded back, and the usual Block>Attack>Throw>Block. What Arc Sys has made a system deep as an ocean, but it isn't inaccessibly complex, everything that I just told you is in the in-depth tutorial which explains every single system of the game. Anything that isn't said in the tutorial, such as Jump Installs and Faultless Defense Cancels, are explained in character Challenges for those who have them. It may sound like a lot to keep in mind, but you can always revisit the tutorial, learn combos in the Challenge mode, and practice the systems and matchups in Mission Mode.

-Content:
I mentioned the Tutorial, Challenge mode, Mission mode, but there is also a Training mode; all of these are part of the Practice section and there is 600 challenges and 50 missions, more than enough to provide a great learning experience. Additionally, there is a singleplayer Arcade mode, which has cutscenes for each character (Except the three bonus characters and the arcade boss). These cutscenes serve as a prologue to the game's Story mode, a 5 hour long anime "Movie", or rather, an animated visual novel, which is the closest thing you will get to an actual Guilty Gear anime. The Story has no gameplay so there is no forced fights that ruin the pace of the story, which happened to me with Mortal Kombat; you can just sit back, relax, and enjoy watching the chaos unfold. The last Single Player mode is M.O.M. mode; a survival game where you can costumize your character with extra special moves, stats, and equipment. To get the items you have to fight for money and loot against opponents with many low health bars (Don't worry, you get multiple health bars as well with score level ups). When an opponent is at his or her last health bar they activate "boss" mode where they get anti knockback armor, attack in patterns, and basically become a Megaman boss. I don't have much experience with this mode, but I really want to play more of it; it's great for practicing Bread n' Butter combos as too!

There are 17 characters, 3 which used to be DLC and you have to unlock with in-game money. I heard unlocking them takes $200,000 for each character (The games currency), but I had them unlocked when I bought it because I got it in the first month, but be prepared to finish every arcade mode to unlock all characters. In total it's a pretty small fighter roster, but considering it's the series' first jump to 3D and the game will have 6 more characters when the new installment comes out (Johnny, Dizzy, Jam, Jack'O, Kum, and Raven), it's not such a big flaw, especially with so many unique and interesting characters. Speaking of which, Revelator is coming out soon so you may want to use this review for that game instead, but be warned, its story is going to be a continuation of -SIGN- so you may want to play this first.

Finally, there is the Online mode. There are Ranked matches, where matchmaking gets you an opponent to fight, and Player matches, where you go to a virtual arcade to fight, spectate, and chat in a lobby with 4 arcade machines and 8 players. Honestly, I have virtually no experience playing on Ranked (Only 2 matches) because I want to be really good before getting a bunch of losses. Nevertheless, the Unranked format is my favorite and is done in many Arc Systems games. Some people don't dig it, but it's really fun to play King of the Hill on one arcade and land an Instant Kill with everyone commenting "OOOOOOH NO HE DIDN'T!". My connection experience varies depending on the location of the person I am playing with, thankfully you can see their connection bars, the host's country, and even the frame delay you are gonna get. You can also set your room to training, private, and M.O.M.

-Music:
Butt rock to its finest: (Parody) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xUZxR-k186I 
But in all seriousness, as a metalhead, I couldn't be more pleased with this games' soundtrack. Every character gets his/her theme and it fits them well. There are songs from previous games too.

-Overall:
9.5/10
+ Extremely deep gameplay.
+ Gorgeous graphics.
+ A lot of modes and learning tools.
+ Fun story.
+ Interesting and colorful characters.
- Jaggy FPS for animations.
- Small Roster.

This is my first review so sorry for it being badly written. Thanks for your time!

21237061.review:
10/10 would Dragon Install and Ground Viper into Eddie Drill and get insta-killed by a Zato main again.

Talking seriously now, there's a lot about this game and it's intricacies that I simply do not know how to put down into a small, digestable review that someone like yourself might scroll down the store page and read to see if you want to buy it.

I'll start with myself I suppose. Before I bought this game I had little to no experience in fighting games other than the original Super Smash Bros. and Brawl. I've heard of the Fighting Game Community and Street Fighter peaked my interest a few times but it never really hooked me into it.

So exactly why did I decide to buy Xrd? A fighting game that really shouldn't be recommended for newcomers? Because of the MOTHER! FUCKING! SOUNDTRACK!!! The OST in this game is absolutely amazing for any rock and even metal lover. Guitar riffs are almost always original and most songs feel like they could be seperate video game themes simply from how good they sound. Diva of Destruction, Give Me A Break, Starry Story, Just Do It are all particular songs that I just can't listen to enough.

But what of the rest of the game?
Well the designs and functionality of each character is extremely unique even within the game's universe. One character does not feel like the other and usually has their own unique playstyle. You have the Big Brooding Badass Sol Badguy who uses a sword more like a hammer and can bust out his Dragon form when shit hits the fan and then you have the (21 year-old) Japanesse Loli Pirate May who is basically the equivalent to Anime Aquaman in terms of power but is actually impactful to the story and is quite useful. From a design standpoint you have a crap ton of variety of characters so you're almost gaurenteed to find someone you like.

The gameplay itself is as solid as I've ever seen. Almost anything can be answered with anything else. The mechanics of Roman Cancel, Faultless Guard, Jump Cancel, Burst and much more intricate mechanics make sure that literally no match is decided by character selection it's all skill and the community as far as I've seen backing this game will do everything in their power to make sure you git gud.

Would I recommend this to someone interested in the fighting genre? Yes. Absolutely yes. Even if you don't take the game seriously enough to be competetive the characters and art style of the game is unique of itself and deserves to at least be tried. I believe anyone who's in the FGC and hasn't at least played a few matches of this game is sorely missing out.

Would I reommend this to just any casual video game player though? No. As I said before there is a lot of stuff to take in when you first pick up this game and it can easily get overwhelming. I studied this game and it's mechanics months before it came out on Steam and the tutorial still overwhelmed me because of how much I needed to consider in a match. It's ultimately fair but at the same time it can be grueling and even cruel at times to newbies.

If you're thinking of buying this game though then go for it. You won't be disappointed I promise. The soundtrack is amazing, characters are great, artstyle and graphics mesh really well together with the combat and ultimately this all comes together to make both the game itself and it's individual battles between players fun to watch and fun to play.

Currently, I'm waiting for SFV to be released so I can get into another fighting game and then after that I'm going to be waiting for BlazBlue ChornoPhantasm Extend (another game I've been hyping myself up to since it's from the same developers that makes GGXrd.) I can wholeheartedly say that this game is the game that got me into the Fighting Games Community and for that I couldn't thank GGXrd, Daisuke Ishiwatari and Arcsys enough.

A word of advice to the newbies from a fellow newbie though. YOU WILL GET YOUR ASS KICKED IN! But do not fret. In fact embrace the ass kicking. Learn from the ass kicking. The only way you're going to ultimately get better is to find a character you like with a playstyle to match your mindset and then just go online and fight. At first you might be discouraged but do not quit. You ARE getting better and you will eventually see your struggle come to fruition when you land your first dust-to-knock down combo in a match, then when you land a perfect Roman Cancel and then finally you'll score your first few wins. And the best part about all that is that you know you did it yourself with no handholding.

Well that was a much longer review than I'd hope.

20910266.review:
길티기어 시리즈의 부활을 알린 신호탄. 그 명성답게 게임은 매우 잘 뽑혔으며, PC판 이식 수준도 훌륭하다.

<진입장벽>
- 존나게 어렵다. 농담이 아니고 진짜 어려운 게임이다. 
길티기어 시리즈는 이 바닥에서도 매니악하기로 소문난 게임이다.
전작에 비해 많이 쉬워졌다곤 하나 그래도 어렵다. 연습 모드나 챌린지 모드를 적극 활용할 것. 
특히 챌린지 모드에선 대전에서 사용할 수 있는 콤보도 여럿 알려주니 꼭 해 보는 것을 추천한다.

<PC판 이식 수준>
- 최적화도 잘 되어 있는 편이며, 한글도 지원한다. 키 설정이 좀 삐꾸라는 단점이 있긴 하나,
패드유저라면 큰 문제는 없을 듯.
키보드유저는....애초에 이 게임을 키보드로 하는 것 자체가 미친 짓 같다...스틱 하나 사자.
이 밖에 대전격투게임들이 으레 가정용에 수록하는 갤러리 모드 같은 자잘한 것들도 
다 수록되어 있는 알찬 구성이다.

<그래픽, OST>
- 마치 만화와 같은 그래픽을 풀 3D로 너무도 잘 구현해냈다. 
이 게임을 처음 시작하면 아마 그래픽에서 가장 놀랄 것이다.
이런 그래픽을 이용한 스토리 모드는 마치 풀 3D 애니메이션을 보는 듯한 느낌을 준다.
또한 이 시리즈의 주 특징 중 하나인 사나이를 울리는 메탈풍의 BGM. 
이번 작도 매우 훌륭한 퀄리티를 보여 주며, 
갤러리 모드에서 전작의 BGM을 사서 들어 보거나, 대전 시 BGM으로 깔아 둘 수도 있어 
팬 서비스적인 부분도 훌륭하다.


키보드 사용 시 키 설정이 조금 불편하다는 것 외에 딱히 꼽을 단점이 없는 수작.
왕년에 격투게임 좀 했거나, 혹은 다 필요없고 여캐보면서 하악대고 싶은 신사들에게 추천한다.

Guilty Gear Xrd veio para nova geração bem repaginado, com gráficos extremamente exuberantes, trazendo personagens novos (e sumindo com antigos... quero minha Dizzy de volta!), e o melhor de tudo: Com a mecânica de jogabilidade sem mudar quase nada com os antigos!

Caso tenha alguma versão já da Steam (XX: Reload ou Ancient Core -menos Isuka, esse é a vergonha da família) e já tenha jogado-os, vai se sentir em casa.
Caso nunca tenha jogado alguma versão do Guilty Gear, mas já jogou BlazBlue, vai se sentir em casa.
Caso nunca tenha jogado algum desses jogos, vai se sentir em casa.

Jogabilidade extremamente fácil e intuitiva (como sempre da Arc System Works) e sem perder a pegada de complexidade de combos de longa escala.
Multiplayer online já acertado e muito bem melhorado, dificilmente tenho tido problemas com jogatina online.
Singleplayer com um story mode bem interessante.

Vale cada centavinho gasto!

20907339.review:
Notable features:
[list]
[*]Extensive tutorial
[*]Frankly excellent online lobby system
[*]A woman who cannot be killed by vampires' preferred means of attack
[*]At least one sword
[*]Production value
[*]A tenuous grasp of what a number is
[*]3D models that do a really good job of pretending to be 2D sprites
[*]One-liners
[/list]

I'm still very bad at fighting games. That doesn't really matter with Guilty Gear Xrd Sign, though, because this game is deceptive. Steam, user reviews, and promotional material may lead you to believe that you are putting down money for a fighting game, not an unreasonable assumption at first. As you pick up the game, in fact, the deception continues. You will swear you are playing a fighting game. It's interactive, fast-paced, sidescrolling. There are quarter circles. Potemkin is there. Don't be fooled, however. What you are really paying for is around 12 episodes of an anime set in the Guilty Gear universe. And it is awesome.

OK, I'm being facetious as usual, but the above paragraph is quite accurate. Arcade mode begins the story, and then there are a solid [b]6+ hours[/b] of cutscene. They split it into its own menu option. Not being a Guilty Gear veteran, said "story mode" didn't make a ton of sense to me overall, but I had a blast nevertheless. The characters are decently developed and play off of each other quite well. There's plenty of over-the-top action and I watched the whole thing in one sitting, eager for more. As for the gameplay, it's pretty much standard for fighting games. There are five distinct attack buttons, you hit the opponent until they fall down twice, some moves flow into each other, you know the drill. Despite my ineptitude, I can tell that this game is solid. The controls are very responsive, and the sound design is top-notch. I would recommend this game to anyone who's even remotely interested, because even if the gameplay turns out to not be your thing the story mode is substantial enough to justify the purchase on its own. And that is not a claim I make lightly.

20589385.review:
私が購入した時の金額は2980円でした。
使用しているPCのスペックはメーカー推奨のものよりもほんの少しだけ低いのですが、オフラインで遊ぶ分には問題なく動いています。

ゲームの内容は格闘ゲームに必要な、

・オフライン＆オンライン対戦機能
・練習モード
・リプレイ記録＆再生機能

等の要素をすべて兼ね備えているといえます。

それに加えアニメのようなムービーでゲームのストーリーを追うストーリーモードも完備しており、内容は大変濃いと言えるでしょう。

おおよそ欠点の付け所の無い本作ですが、一つだけ難点を挙げるとすれば、

「オンライン対戦時、良くて1F、悪いと20F近くも遅延が起こる。」

この点が気になった点でしょうか・・・

プレイヤー同士それぞれの通信環境にも左右されるのでしょうが、この点は対戦ツールとして大変苦しい点かと思います。

しかし、この値段とこの内容、オフラインであれば遅延は起こらない。
ここまでの内容であれば、自宅で友人や家族と遊んだり、アーケードデビュー前の練習用と割り切れば大変素晴らしいソフトであると思います。

十分皆さんにお勧めできるソフトであると思います。

20569479.review:
The port of this game is very good by most standards as the Netplay and Ranked is functioning pretty well along with improvements done through patching that removed some noteable issues including Memory leaks and region locking. The gameplay itself is also fast paced with a good cast of mostly balanced characters. The best part is that this is one of the few fighting games that are immediately getting patches coming in for any issues.

Overall, If you are into fighting games, Its not hard to recommend this game as Its pretty competitive and gives you a wide array of in-match options without much overhead (IE picking styles/grooves/Assists before fights). Its just a straight 2-D fighter.

I cannot comment on the DLC policy as I am an early adopter. Story mode is pretty decent but It does follow some Anime-likeness (as expected, it is a 2-D Fighter from JP), but dont go into it expecting a large fighting tourny. seriously, you probably could youtube the Story and get the same experience. 

Complaints for the game include ranked play being kind of a lost cause compared to player matches. This is mostly blamed on the messed up starting of ranked games when the game came out causing it to lose traction. There is some issues related to connecting to players for a select few, but this is fixable by port forwarding or just trying again to connect. Last issue the lack of windowed full screen. Outside that, its pretty good and includes most things you expect of a PC game such as v-sync, FFXA and other post processing along with both languages and individual volume controls.

20512500.review:
Uno de los reyes de la lucha 2D vuelve a la carga en PC, y de que manera!!!

Graficos: Simplemente impresionantes, en su estilo claro, realmente durante las partidas parece que estemos ante un juego echo con sprites HD y durante las cinematicas parece que estemos viendo un anime. Desgraciadamente para jugar al juego a una resolución mayor de 1080 nos hara falta un programa externo, decir que de todas formas el juego a 4K lo muevo con soltura.

Sonido: Los sonidos son buenos pero la banda sonora... simplemente atronadora, potencia pura, si te gusta el metal este juego te encantara.

Jugabilidad: Impresionante, uno de los pocos de este estilo que sigue fiel a sus raices (tambien puede ser un punto negativo, ya que para algunos es poco novedoso) como en los anteriores la jugabilidad es frenetica y los combates tremendamente agresivos comparados con los otros 2D Fighting games (KoF o Street Fighter por ejemplo).

Controles: Muy sencillos comparados con otros del mismo genero, lo que a algunos les hara parecer que es un juego poco tecnico, esto es así ya que esta pensado para que los combates sean más freneticos y se utilicen las mecanicas propias del juego. Como punto negativo aunque pasa en todos los juegos de lucha tanto 2D como 3D se nota mucho quien utiliza controladores especiales para este juego.

20442833.review:
When Guilty Gear XX Reloaded came out it was the best fighting game of its time.  Now, ArcSys returns to the franchise that helped establish it in the fighting game arena.  It's hard to judge this title on its own merits; if it were in a vacuum this undoubtably be an easy reccomendation as a great fighting game.  

However, Guilty Gear XX was so different at the time mostly due to it's wide variety of character types in its roster (many of which had mechanics that were unseen in other fighting games).  While the characters we're given are very unique it's hard to not think about the miriad of memorable roster cuts from the last instalment of the series.  Also, the spiritual successor of Guilty Gear, BlazBlue, has come and shown us that some of the more eccentric quirks of that made many Guilty Gear characters stand out can be distilled into more focused characters that keep their flavor while being much more intuitive.

So, Guilty Gear Xrd is a little hard to wholeheartedly recommend.  It's a fantastic nostalgia trip for those who remember the older games and a solid fighter for sure.  The innovative take on animating a cel-shaded 2.5d fighter is also almost worth the price of admission alone.  However, I don't think ArcSys' latest is its greatest as BlazBlue really did take what Guilty Gear started and push the envelope into fighting game rocket science.  Even if we avoid comparisons to BlazBlue it's hard to tell if this is even a more complete game than the last Guilty Gear that came out over a decade ago.

So this is a very tenative recommendation.  It's a good fighting game and Guilty Gear deserved a re-visit.  However, this installment isn't enough to make me feel this is the definitive Guilty Gear over the last installment and ArcSys has already gone on to do better things.

20411599.review:
Pretty sure every review that isn't oggling Ram has said most of what needs to be said.

Online is smooth and functional. Good luck finding Ranked matches, however. Most play will be in the Player Lobbies. Fortunately, as of the first month, there's usually a good number of lobbies and players with a range in skill, so it's easy to have fun getting your ass kicked and watching others follow your example. If you've got friends to play with, or want to engage in a great fighter online, then this a pretty gold example in a world where Netherealm servers are still a thing.

The tutorial and challenge modes are some of the best in the genre, easing in new players and vets alike to the system mechanics and basic fundementals before you ever have to tackle a real match. You can spend hours in training without even realizing it. The combat is streamlined compared to past entries, but for the better in most cases (YRCs never needed to be as stupid tight to pull off for how integral they are to Guilty Gear's combat).

Single player is a mixed bag outside of learning. Story is eh, but like the gameplay, does a good job of explaining everything to newcomers to the series, wraps up quickly enough and offers plenty to those willing to sink their teeth into it. Arcade is your simple 8 AI fights wrapping up with a rival and final boss. M.O.M mode is an incredible grind with RPG elements attached to the fighter experience, and that's really all that's left. 

These modes might be more enjoyable if the AI were any bit competant but unfortunately they're pushovers. Even on the hardest difficulty setting they rarely play like any decent player, lacking any pressure or severe combos to punish players, and they give no indication as to how the respective character is meant to be played. This is crucial, because now a player not only needs to play against real players to test how valid their practice is, but to also learn matchups outside of the tiny bit the challenge modes cover. The AI is very bland by comparison to the great example SFV has set in place (Even if that is a much simpler game).

Also, as is usual of Aksys, this version of the game will soon be outdated in a few months thanks to their God awful PC Release schedules, and the same will be said of Blazblue CPE once that releases 2 years after the first iteration came to consoles.
If you own a PS3/4, wait for Revelator. If you only game on PC, this is the most accessible, up to date Guilty Gear available. If you've ever wanted to pick up on the series, start here and support more fighting games for PC.

20331590.review:
Millia Best Waifu 10/10

Me alegra que ArcSystemWorks se este dando cuenta del potencial mercado que tiene el PC. 
Esperemos ver Revelator junto con el lanzamientos de consolas.


Con respecto a -SIGN-:
Graficos/Tecnico: Lo mas sobresaliente a simple vista, el juego utiliza modelos 3d (aunque no lo parezca) animados con pocos frames para dar la ilusion de dibujos. Los modelados de los personajes estan bien trabajados asi como los escenarios, algunos son dignos de admirarse por su belleza.
60fps estables como rocas en mi R9 270x. Excelente port se marco Arcsys.

Sonido/Musica: Las voces tanto en ingles como en japones brillan por su calidad de doblaje. En cuanto a la musica cumple sobradamente pero me parece inferior a su anterior entrega. (Escuchad el tema de Millia de AC+R y compararlo con este, ambos muy buenos pero el primero esta a otro nivel)

Gameplay: Lo mas importante para este tipo de juegos, no soy un experto en juegos de pelea 2d pero el juego cumple perfectamente en contenido para personas no han jugado ni GG ni un otro juego de pelea.
Tenemos Tutorial, Challenges, Misiones, y modo training. Lo necesario para empezar a jugar decentemente. 
En cuanto al balance, no he mirado ningun personaje OP o sobresaliente del resto. 

Lo que mas me gusta de las mecanicas de combate es que es amigable con jugadores inexpertos, ya que si bien un experto puede ejecutar combos largos, estos son dificiles de hacer y no recompensan en daño al oponente, pues conforme el combo aumenta los golpes reducen su daño. Ademas del burst para romper su combo. La experiencia del novato puede ser menos frustante que en otros juegos.

Gracias por leer mi analisis por encima del juego.

20291018.review:
Guilty Gear, 恭贺重生！

作为收回GG版权后，真正意义的系列复活新作，这次突然闪电公布移植steam着实是个惊喜。
虽然吸收了bb的一些成功经验，却仍然能让人感到，这确实是GG，充满了强烈的ASW风格。
相对于Blazblue，明显感到演出效果的大幅度强化，大幅使用3D建模的情况下，依旧保留了ASW一贯推崇的动画化游戏体验。
系统设计的更加友好，教学/挑战模式等一应俱全，同时也适当地降低了入门门槛，不过GG本身也算是较难入门的格斗系列了。
剧情方面，故事继承自GG2，并有着独立的故事模式，即使格斗苦手同样能享受到乐趣，毕竟ASW，格斗界的gal大厂（误）。
人设可能老玩家不太习惯，大幅削减的人物也是易被诟病之处。
配乐一如既往的出色。

期待Revelator早日登陆steam！

Heaven or Hell!

Damn it's Guilty Gear!

Amazing visuals, AMAZING soundtrack, tight controls, with a more flexible response than say A Core. Also finally a decent training mode teaching you both basics and advanced stuff, which you had to guides to look at for.

AND finally a Story mode! 3+ hour anime, with quite interesting plot.

Also Online with lobbies, with 4 rooms per lobby. You can spectate, wait, and swap sparring partners.. just great. Online wasn't working that well at launch as I heard, but had no problems personally, and it seems now it is patched.

Characters are pretty balanced, though some are harder to master than others. Still if your'e not a Tier whore you won't care about it much. Each character is strong in it's own way, and with Unreal engine everyone looks just amazing.

Quite interested in how Revelator will come to Steam (not so soon thoug) will it be an expansion or a brand new game.

20147122.review:
[h1] "Guns and Steel, this is what i am!" [/h1]

Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN- è la prima versione di questo fantastico picchiaduro. Attualmente, nel periodo di scrittura di questa recensione [h1] [31/12/2015] [/h1] è in lavorazione la versione -REVELATOR- Che conterrà molte aggiunte, tra cui come personaggi i già visti negli altri Guilty Gear, ovvero Jam, Johnny e Dizzy. I personaggi vengono scelti con varie votazioni da parte dell'ArcSystem ogni anno.

Tolta questa breve parentesi, il gioco in sè è definibile come un [h1] ''Easy to play, Hard to master'' [/h1] Nel senso che i vari personaggi hanno varie combo semplici ripetibili, che di solito sono Punch, Slash e Heavy Slash, e varie Overdrive (Praticamente delle mosse speciali) eseguibili eseguendo particolari pattern di movimento, seppur queste siano diverse per ogni personaggio (Per esempio eseguire con l'analogico di movimento una mezzaluna e poi un movimento diagonale verso il basso per poi cliccare Heavy Slash) che a prima vista risultano molto complesse, ma basta allenarsi un pò e ci si può prendere la mano abbastanza in fretta. Inoltre ogni personaggio ha uno stile particolare, per esempio ci sono Millia e Chipp che scarseggiano con difesa ma hanno un danno molto elevato, o personaggi come Sin, estremamente potenti ma che richiedono di eseguire una combinazioni per ''ricaricare'' le loro abilità. (Per esempio Sin deve mangiare per acquisire forza, in quanto moltissime sue mosse li riducono l'indicatore fame) Insomma, la curva d'apprendimento c'è, e si sente molto, richiedendo abbastanza tempo e impegno.

La storia è molto bella, e se vorreste vederla (è un lunghissimo filmato, praticamente) dovreste prima completare l'arcade di tutti i personaggi per capirne qualcosa nelle battute iniziali. Inoltre se questo è il primo capitolo di GG che giocate, non preoccupatevi: Durante i dialoghi le parole chiavi saranno sottolineate in Giallo, permettendovi di mettere in pausa la scena per leggere un breve approfondimento su di questa. E' anche possibile accedere ad una cronologia di tutti gli eventi accaduti nei giochi e nella lore in generale. Evito spoiler di ogni tipo su di questa, sappiate che è molto complessa, di classica fattura Giapponese, ai livelli di un Dark Souls, nel senso che è ben nascosta e con vari buchi che l'utente ha libera scelta di interpretare.

Oltre a questo, Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN- Ha anche una modalità Versus, anche locale, la modalità M.O.M, praticamente un RPG a livelli dentro un picchiaduro, uno shop dove comprare con valuta di gioco molti bonus, una replay mode per vedere i propri scontri locali o online, una training mode con le apposite challenge e un tutorial molto ben fatto. Inoltre nelle opzioni ci sono varie scelte per i settaggi grafici, anche se il gioco è in se molto leggero. E' anche possibile scegliere la voce del sistema nel menù e nei match tra tutti i personaggi del gioco, con tanto di commento a seconda di chi scegliamo.

Graficamente e anche sul sonoro il gioco è fenomenale: Il gioco è praticamente un Anime in 3D, con un uso fantastico di cel-shading ed effetti di falso 2D, che rende il tutto davvero incredibile. Inoltre Elogio vivamente la Colonna sonora, Fantastica e con brani che restano in testa.

L'unica pecca del gioco è purtroppo il match-making e il netcode, davvero fatti male, con molti problemi anche per connettersi tra amici dello stesso paese o in lobby di altri player. Spero vivamente che nel periodo dopo la scrittura di questa recensione, il problema sia risolto del tutto.

In conclusione, GGXrd Merita tantissimo, in quanto mostra come i picchiaduro siano giocabili su PC e come questi possano rinnovarsi stando al passo coi tempi sia con il gameplay che con la grafica. 
Ultima nota: Il gioco è giocabile ottimamente sia con Controller, Fight Stick o Tastiera. A voi la scelta.

Some of the most fun I've had in a long time. Highly recomended if you want to get into a 2D fighter. It has a great totourial to get you going, and comboes are not nearly as hard as they are in some other fighting games. Loads of single player content if you wanna take the time to do it.

20127438.review:
Let me level with you. Guilty Gear is an amazing game, arcsys makes the best 2D air dashing fighting games in the world. XRD is a fresh reboot, which throws out a lot of the complexity from the older games while maintaining the classic feel of some of the most iconic characters around.

The systems are great with some draw-backs here and there, and the visual style of xrd is second to none.

XRD is a game that plays fast and aggressive while looking amazing.

However the PC port is extremely garbage. If you look around Dustloop, SRK, and the steam community you'll find lots of complains about frame rate issues.

I've got an amd cpu and an nvidia gpu, my friend has the same gpu and one model worse on the amd cpu. His game runs fine, mine doesn't.

Now, what happens is after a number of matches (about 10 or so) the framerate goes from a solid stable 60, down to 30 and the game becomes unplayable.

As I've mentioned, I looked into this a lot before refunding the game, this happens to all combinations of amd and intel cpus and also nvidia and amd gpus. Online, offline, it doesn't matter. For many people the game is just unplayable.

XRD is a fantastic game and I've loved it since the NA release on ps3, I'm just upset that I can't play with my pc friends.

For the sake of clarity I've tried a couple of fixes that were suggested online, both on forums and the steam community. I tried various configurations with nvidia control panel, in game settings, resets, game cache validation, re-installing the game, and nothing fixed the problem. Time and time again, after a number of matches the frame rate would halve rendering the game unplayable.

20122308.review:
まず、対戦目的で購入されている方にはおすすめしません。
「対戦なんざどうでも良い。石渡のキャラがガシガシ動くのが見てーんだ！」という人は迷う必要なんてありません。買え。

◎良い点
期間限定で全DLCとサントラが無料
家庭用とほぼ同じ内容

◎悪い点
ネット対戦の人口が少ない
動作遅延が起こりやすい


・期間限定全DLC無料について
家庭用でのDLC価格を参考にすると、
１．追加キャラ：シン＝キスク 250円
　(ゲーム内通貨によりアンロック可能)
２．追加キャラ：エルフェルト＝ヴァレンタイン 800円
３．追加キャラ：レオ＝ホワイトファング 800円
４．システムボイス：全キャラおまとめパック　3500円
５．キャラクターカラー：全キャラおまとめパック 1200円
と、ゲーム内でアンロック可能なシンを除く２～５のDLC合計6300円分が2016年1月12日まで全て無料だそうです。
アレルギーによりDLCの購入を医師に止められていた私も安心して遊ぶ事が出来ました。おトクですね。

・家庭用との相違点について
主な内容は家庭用と同じです。
※ネット対戦時のロビーが削除されましたが、個人的にはあってもわずらわしいだけだったので寧ろ改良点です。

・ネット対戦の人口の少なさ
人口の少なさは、家庭用発売から更に1年経過してのリリースなので仕方無いのかもしれませんが･･･
2015年12月末現在、ゴールデンタイムであればプレイヤーマッチで日本人との対戦に難儀する事はありません。
ただ、ランクマッチでがっつり段位戦をご希望ならば、今からでも家庭用の購入を検討された方が良いかと。

・動作遅延(ゲームは1日1時間！機能)について
致命的です。
ネット対戦時の動作遅延については、自分と相手側の回線環境に加えPCスペックや裏で動いている別プログラム等々があるゆえ期待してはいませんでした。
しかし、1～2時間程プレイしているだけで60FPSだったのが40～60FPSをいったりきたりと安定しなくなります。
ネット対戦時だけならまだしも、オフラインモードであるMOMにこもっている最中にも何度か発生したので回線環境に関係無く発生する様です。
脳汁が分泌する様なギンギンな試合をしていようが、その最中に遅延が発生すると途端にしなしなになります。気分が。
なんなんでしょうか。「そんな何時間もゲームしとらんと、そろそろ休みぃやー」とでも言っているのでしょうか。
オカンか。
私はこれを「高橋○人機能」と呼ぶ事にしました。


◎総評
格闘ゲームに最も求められるものは「充実した対戦環境」であると私は考えています。
ゆえに、ネット対戦人口が少なく、遅延が発生し易いPC版を私はおすすめしません。

(ネット対戦目的ならとっくに家庭用版を買ってるっつーの！という反論は都合良く私の耳に届かないのでご了承下さい)

20102947.review:
I'd like to preface this review by stating that I'm not a fighting game enthusiast. 

In fact, the only real experience I have with 2D Fighters prior to GGXrd is The King of Fighters XIII-- and I wasn't really a fan of that game. Despite my inexperience with the genre, I can say that [u]Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN-[/u] has salvaged my interest.

[b]CHARACTERS:[/b]

The characters in Guilty Gear are, well, ridiculous. From a sleeping boy who wields a weaponized bed to a British time traveler, the cast covers all the bases. Each fighter has a unique playstyle and, in many cases, a more peculiar fashion sense. Whether you want to fight with swords, sickles, anchors, flowers, billiard balls, or your own hair, Guilty Gear has it all. Another nice aesthetic are the palette options (skins) for each character-- all of them look great!

[b]GAMEPLAY:[/b]

Although my arcade-fighter backlog isn't extensive by any means, I know that GGXrd plays great. The controls are simple, combos easy to pick up, and the fighting overall feels tight and responsive. Fights against NPCs seem fair with an appropriate amount of challenge. This means I can actually play Arcade and other AI game modes without the fights becoming too tedious or underwhelming.

[b]SOUND/VISUAL:[/b]

Something that anyone, novice or veteran to fighting games, will notice immediately is the polish [i] all over [/i] GGXrd. While the character models are 3D rendered, they still manage to appear beautifully 2D. This effect really brings the game to life and allows for over-the-top battle intros and special attack cinematics. 

The voice acting in this game is impressive, too. Having no original preference, I tried out both the English and Japanese vocals and ended up loving both. Each character's tone seems to fit so well, their voices emotive and packed with energy. 

Xrd's soundtrack is also worth mentioning. From what I can tell, a lot of the BGMs were brought back from past Guilty Gear titles and given new life-- my personal favorite being May's [i] Starry Story[/i] .

[b] OVERALL (TL;DR) [/b]

It's safe to say that [u]Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN-[/u] showed me how fun fighting games can be. Everything about this game prevents it from being just another bland entry in the genre. The characters, visuals, and music are never lackluster and they brilliantly show off the devotion that ArcSys has to their games.

20027999.review:
Great fighting game with an excellent netcode (3-4f delay "Germany - Russia", 1f delay "Germany-Netherlands"), an awesome soundtrack and a great visual presentation. 

Every character (17 in total) feels really unique to play with and the game offers a great variety of missions, challenges and a tutorial to get used to the game. The online lobby system of XRD puts the main fighting game contender on PC (USF4 and even the upcoming SFV) to shame, because it offers an incredible amount of options to customize your lobby for your netplay sessions.

Definitely recommended for everyone who wants to try out a new fighting game and who is sick of USF4.

I played this game extensivley on console and was very much looking forward to the PC version because it would allow me to play on my laptop where ever I go.

However, there is a fatal bug causing me to not be able to play.
Backing out of the pause menu causes the game to crash.
In the off-chance a dev sees this, I'll try to detail the crash state as best I can...
-The game does not freeze
-The sound effect for backing out of the menu still plays
-The menu remains on screen, though all animations continue playing [Like the spinning gear on the menu]
-All inputs become unresponsive

So just letting you know, there does exist a game-breaking, but highly uncommon bug. Buy the game, it's amazing, don't let my playtime dictate that. But I honestly don't know of a better way of reporting this bug to the devs. If someone does, please do that for me. I want to play this game.

20018602.review:
面白い！このゲームをやりだしてアケコンを買ってしまった、それくらい面白い
ただ褒めるレビューだとあれなので、良い点と悪い点を書きたいと思います。

■良い点
-----------------------------------------
1. グラフィックが美麗
2. コンボが楽しい
3. キャラが魅力的(ボインちゃん)、個性が強い
4. トレーニングモードの充実
-----------------------------------------

① 【グラフィックが美麗】
グラフィックに関しては、「Unreal Engine 3」を採用しており、フル3Dグラフィックスで表現されている、ぱっと見２Dに見るが全て3D。

② 【コンボが楽しい】
コンボの難易度は格ゲー初心者の人には少し高め、入力の複雑さもあるが、タイミングをしっかりと掴まないとうまくいかない。コンボで連打してしまう人なんかは最初かなり躓くだろう。しかしそのコンボが綺麗に決まった時の爽快感はかなりぎもじぃ

③【キャラが魅力的】
各キャラクターはとても魅力的、かわいい系からお姉さん系から紳士、ワイルドおじさん(砕けろ)と必ず好みのキャラが見つかるだろう。

④【トレーニングモードの充実】
このゲームはとにかくトレーニングモードが充実している。各キャラ固有のトレーニングモードも用意されていて、基本技、基本コンボ、ちょっとした応用、実用的なコンボまで段階的にステップを踏んで覚えていくことができる。
また、技以外にも、このゲームの基本、ジャンプ、２段ジャンプ、空中ダッシュやガードの種類、など様々な基本操作を学べるトレーニングモードも用意されている。格ゲー初心者も安心して入っていけるだろう。


■悪い点
-----------------------------------------
1. 多少重い
2. 接続が不安定
3. 同時接続人数は多くはない
4. 問題点はまだ多い
-----------------------------------------

①【多少重い】
ゲームは多少重い、重いというよりは軽くはない。ある程度のスペックがあれば問題なく動くと思うが、スペックが対戦中のラグにもつながるので、購入の際は必要スペックをよく確認して購入したほうがいい。この辺はアップデートで少しずつ改善されていくとおもう。

②【接続が不安定】
オンライン対戦はまだ安定していないのが現状、PS4などと違い、個々で環境が異なる事も大きい。
PCスペック、回線の安定性が必要値に達している人同士であれば快適にプレイできるが、片方が多少足りないスペックや回線が遅いとすぐにラグがでる。また、アップデートで改善されたとあるが、実際はまだ改善されていない。

③【 同時接続人数は多くはない】
対戦ゲームは、人がいないと始まらない。
Steam格ゲーユーザーがPS系と比べると少ないのが現状。
「多くはない」と言ったのは、少なくはないという事、深夜帯でなければだいたい部屋はある。
pm19:00時あたりからはかなり増えるので対戦に困ることはないので心配いらない。

④【問題点はまだ多い】
まだ実装間もない為、強制終了やマッチングの切断など、不具合も多い。
が、放置される事はまずないとおもうので、アップデートを待とう。


■まとめ
色々書きましたが、かなりオススメです。
格ゲーに今まで手をだしていない人、他の格ゲーはやった事あるけどギルティは敷居が高そう・・
なんて思ってる人も思い切って購入してみてはいかがでしょうか。
今なら初心者の方も比較的多いので始めるなら今！

ギルティプレイヤーが沢山増えるといいな！ミストラヴァイエ！

20002770.review:
Ok, so I first saw this game on Friday Night Fisticuffs (a semi-weekly YouTube show on good fighting games, along with Saturday Morning Scrublords which covers the other side of the spectrum), and thought: -Well damn, that looks pretty awesome, I just might get that!
While googling around I found a fascinating video from GDC (Game Developer Conference), where a developer (whose name I can't remember of the top of my head, sorry) talked about and showed the creation process behind the graphical style, which was the game's main selling point.
The graphical style being anime with 3D models, which as far as I know is the first time it has been done in a game like this. Note that they even reduced the frames in the animations so it would look more like "regular anime".
(I also found a price tag somewhere:59.99, whoa!)

Well then, as for the game itself. I'm just going to throw this out there, I have never played a Guilty Gear game before, and I've proven myself time and time again to be horrible at fighting games, so I am not really the best person to give this game a fair review.

What can I say, the game is fun, looks awesome, it's colorful, the soundtrack is pretty good and I guess it kinda' helps building the style of the game.
The characters look awesome and the voice actors fit (admittedly, I have only played with the japanese voices 'cause I was recommended to do so, my inner weeaboo approves)

Like I said, awful at fighting games, so the first thing I go to is the tutorial, which just covers the basics, then goes WAY deep with the Roman cancels (which I forgot about, until I got the achievment by accident).

To conclude, as a game, neat. Probably wouldn't work as your first fighting game, barely worked as my second.
Still, don't take it from me, I'm just over here semi-mashing my way through the arcade mode.

Okay. I have spent 4 hours straight enjoying this game. First of all, I started my fighting game journey with Skullgirls. I initially mained Filia, then Fukua. These characters fought with their hair... so the first character in GG Xrd I pick up is "Millia"... funny. "ilia" and hair attacks, I rolled with it. I noticed a similar playstyle in both, I got hyped.

Long-story-short: I now main Millia. When it comes to combos though, this game does not make it easy. Skullgirls made my life a living hell. Not while I played it, [i]after[/i] I played it. I honestly can't combo worth a shit, but I want to learn- which is definitely a good thing. It's hard for a game to make me angry and want to learn at the same time. Last time this happened was with Skullgirls.

Sorry I keep making comparisons, I just found it my primary source of comparison, given, I have played SF4 and did not have a fun time with it.
So. Would I recommend picking this game up? Yes... without a doubt. Only $30, all characters, all skins, tons of playtime and even a competitive scene.

This game requires quick as-fuck hand movements, great memorization/muscle memory, and a willingness to get better. In other words: Buy this if you like fighting games that take effort and reward greatly.

19969020.review:
Let me tell you something: If you're a fan of fighting games, you HAVE to play this game.
If you played previous games before, you notice some changes in Xrd. First, Multi pathed story mode is removed (from what I've seen so far) and for a better understanding of the story, you have to complete arcade mode with all of the characters first and then move on to the story mode. Second, Unlike the previous games (or BlazBlue series), Xrd has 2.5D visuals. Third, Because of changes in story mode system, arcade mode is changed too and you don't have to face Ramlethal (A.K.A. The boss character) for every character. I mean, with some characters (like Slayer), you never get to fight her.
Now for the story... From what I read, the story begins after the events of Guilty Gear 2: Overture (which I never played :( ) and tells the events of.... Well, I better not spoil it here. Also, Xrd has very great surprises for you if you have played GGXXAC+R on Steam. like: [spoiler] Chipp is now a president! [/spoiler] and you can unlock several musics from AC+R for matches. (like The Midnight Carnival)
Gameplay is still the same: Fast and hard to master. And everything is still in place: Instant kills, Roman cancels, Dust move, Burst, etc...

Overall, It's a very great game and this port had a way better launch on PC than Lag Kombat X. Sure, It has some problems (that I know will be fixed) but it's playable. Also, some of those problems are fixed now (like the ugly looking HUD) after the 3GB update (large size, don't you agree?).
Okay, let's finish this. You want to have a very good fighting game? Then buy this game AND GET READY TO ROCK!
Oh, and by the way.... Thank you Arc System Works for bringing this great fighting game to PC platform. I'm looking forward to see BBCPE and Xrd Revelator!

19962645.review:
Absolutely amazing game.  Very polished in all aspects.  The graphics are simply stunning.  Netcode seems very good too, I'm living in Taiwan and playing with my friend back in Hawaii (my connection seems to go to california, and then bounces back to him in Hawaii so that should speak loads for the netcode quality) without any instability, just a few frames of delay, which is all auto calucated for seamless play. 

Favorite fighting game in a long time and there is simply no reason not to buy this whether you're a fighting game fan or just a Guilty Gear fan.  I'm just average skill level at fighting games so I can't give any detailed pro's and cons on mechanics but it feels very fair, but also high skill cap.  It doesn't seem like any mechanics have been removed since I last played GG X2.

I don't have a single complaint for this game, and I'm usually a heavy critic.  The only possible complaint anyone could have is that you can't use the mouse for menu navigation, it all has to be done via controller or WASD/arrows.  That's literally it, and as far as I'm concerned that isn't even a valid complaint for the genre since any remotely serious player has a stick or at least a controller.

19951049.review:
Great port and comes with everything the console versions of Xrd, including the extra colours. Console DLC characters are all unlocked free of charge at the beginning, which is nice. The story actually is decently long and the characters are unique and vaired, so you'll probably find someone you like among the cast. There's also a tutorial mode which is great for newbies to anime fighters or just fighters in general, so if you're new and are considering picking this up, go for it. 

Couple other things to note are:
- Graphics are amazing, really good compared to most fighters this gen.
- Soundtrack is great.
- Mobility is pretty big in this game, so if you're a smash player or just like to move around a lot it'll probably be more enjoyable compared to something like Street Fighter. 
- Combos are easier than most fighters, too. 
- Netcode is extremely good. I've been able to play with American players with virtually no lag at all.

All I want out of this game now is for them to release revelator asap.

Best 2D fighter. I mean it's even better than street fighter in therms of fun while the mechanics are deeper. The game is really rewarding for those who spent time to improve. 

Quality :

19904488.review:
オヌヌメ！
■よいところ
　GGXrdはグラフィックが2Dチックな3Dでとてもよいのですが、steam版はPS4版のグラフィックなのか更に綺麗になっています。オヌ。
　コンシューマ版ではDLC（追加カラー,追加キャラ)として配信されているものがsteam版発売から1ヶ月間全部入りの無料で今がメッチャ買いです。ついでに1ヶ月すぎても追加キャラはゲーム内通貨（ゲーム内で色々やると溜まる）で買えるらしいので過ぎても買い。
　充実のチュートリアル。同じアークかつてブレイブルーCS時代のチュートリアルはチュートリアルもクソもありませんでしたが今回はかなりまともで、なおかつチャレンジモードにそこそこ実用的なコンボがあるので未経験者にも優しいです。
　今時大体の格闘ゲームはそうですがどのキャラも個性的でなおかつそれなりに対戦バランスがいいのでどのキャラを選んでもおもしろい。

■わるいところ
　コンシューマ版にあったオンラインロビーが削除。プレマや（特に）ランクマで対戦を承認してもらうまえにはじかれることが多い。それにともなうランクマのテンポの悪さ。



　全体的にオヌなので格闘ゲームしたいって人は買いましょう。
　アーケードではキャラと新システムが増えたGUILTY GEAR Xrd -REVELATOR-が稼動中ですが既存キャラの性能は据え置きなので既存キャラを使ってアーケードに繰り出してみたいって人の練習にもオヌヌメです。

그래픽으로 취저당한 수많은 덕후들의 마음을 꺾기로 소문난 겜 그 두번째 (첫번째는 뼈순이들이라 카더라).

개인적인 소감으론 격겜중에서도 진입장벽이 꽤 높은 듯 싶습니다. 입력타이밍이 되게 빡세서 튜토리얼(챌린지) 다 깨기도 벅참.
하지만 그딴 거 없이 프랙티스모드 켜놓고 일격기 써가며 캐릭터 얼굴이나 핥기만 해도 이득인 게임입니다. 3D와 2D의 경계를 정말 교묘하게 잘 탔습니다. 아니메 스타일 그래픽으로는 이 게임이 정점 아닌가 싶을 정도...
다만 스토리모드의 연출은 아쉬운 편. 그래픽 수준은 높지만 액팅이 별로라 스탠딩 CG가 나오는 것과 다를 바가 없습니다. 다만 게임의 장르가 격투게임이고, 스토리는 어디까지나 곁다리인 것이니 큰 문제점은 되지 않는다고 봅니다. 그리고 아무리 액팅이 구려터졌어도 카이가 죤ㄴ나예쁘기 때문에 용서가 됩니다. 카이 존예보스.

19867624.review:
The almost-perfect sequel for the best fighter series so far. I'm a little disappointed that some of the classic old fighters are upcoming in the next game (Jam and Johnny, also some classics like Testament and Dizzy are missing), but otherwise it's just what you'd want from a next-generation Guilty Gear.
Awesome graphics coupled with perfect OST made by Daisuke Ishiwatari. And of course, the best gameplay mechanics of fighter games. I'd recommend this game to anyone who's searching for a new hyper-fighter game and to any fan of Guilty Gear games. It's not the best possible game for a total beginner in fighter genre, but the tutorial mode tries its best to help newer players.
Aside from the lack of classic characters, the only other major downside of Xrd Sign is that PC has a lack of players in multiplayer, at least in Europe servers. So prepare yourself for long queue times.

19839005.review:
当方格ゲーは超絶初心者です
このGGXrdを買った理由は、UnrealEngineを用いて3Dを2D風にみせる技術で
一時期ゲーム開発業界界隈で話題になっていたからです
現在はひとまずアーケードモード全キャラクリア及びストーリー全読破した状態です
アケコンはHORIのRAP V3 SA カスタムを利用（普段はSTG用などで使ってます）

■良い点
・とても3Dとは思えないUE3によるアニメ調2D風グラフィックス（2.5D）
・キャラクターが皆個性的かつユニーク
・特別な技を掛けた時対戦キャラによって様々なバリエーションで動き、喋りまくります
・ストーリーモードは見てるだけのUEでグリグリ動く超高級紙芝居（約4時間ほど）内容も素晴らしいです
・MOM（RPG風モード）などソロのやり込み要素あり
・アートやBGM等の収集要素あり
・安い（今ならDLC全部入り（３８個） サントラ入り DLCはCS版だと有料のもの発売後１ヶ月限定）
・アップデートでUIリソースの高画質化がされたため4K解像度でも十分耐えられる品質

■悪い点
・ボーダレスウインドウモードが無い
・箱コンとアケコン同時差し状態で箱コン側が動作しなくなる（つまりローカル対戦が出来ない　おま環かも）

格ゲーはストーリーはあってないようなものかと思っていましたがこの作品で考えを改めました
対戦ではコンボメインらしいので難易度的に初心者向きかは少し微妙ですが、
トレーニングモードなどのモードも豊富で作りが親切なため初心者でも少しずつ上達出来そうな感じです
箱コンでも少し遊んでみましたが練習すれば技が出ないということはないと思います（要は慣れの問題）
今後もっと練習して対戦にも挑戦したらまたレビューを更新します

19835503.review:
El mejor juego de lucha de Arc System Works.
Jugabilidad, música metal, gráficos cel-shading perfectos (parece realmente un anime) e historia que engancha (aunque de menos duración que la historia de Blazblue). Todo perfecto. Netplay en partida de jugador OK tras la actualización, aunque hacen falta más jugadores.
El tutorial va más alla de enseñar las mecanicas de juego, incluye modo desafio para practicar los combos de cada personaje y modo misiones que enseña que acciones realizar cuando se dan ciertas situaciones en combates reales y matchups.
Cosas menos buenas:
 - Es el comienzo de la historia de Xrd y por lo tanto aún no están todos los personajes de anteriores entregas.
 - Pocos elementos desbloqueables en Galería, unos pocos artworks, voces y músicas de GGXX y GG Overture.
 - El modo M.O.M consiste en grindear para obtener experiencia e items para un modo de juego que poca gente va a jugar online, y jugar un solo jugador se hace tedioso.

Não sabe jogar jogos de luta em geral?? Também não é um problema pois existe um sistema detalhando todos os movimentos e conceitos basicos que você precisa tanto no jogo quanto em outros FG.
Você precisa de uma Waifu? Aqui tem de sobra, só escolher e dedicar todo seu amor a ela!
Recomendo infinitamente!!
