19623084.review:
The Game:

Guilty Gear Xrd is a 2D anime fighter in the same line as Blazblue, Arcana Heart, UNIEL, etc. Or rather they are in the same line as it, considering how long Guilty Gear has been around. Xrd -Sign sports a roster of 17 character, 12 which are returning veterans. The 5 new characters are all somewhat more gimicky than the veterans but are a nice addition and fit in well regardless.

Game modes include standard affairs like arcade, versus, and training modes, as well as a challenge mode that has specific trials for each character that help you learn them ala Street Fighter 4 or Blazblue. It contains a story mode, which is about a 5 hour long anime more than anything else, as you don't fight in it. MOM mode also makes a comeback but has been heavily revamped. Instead of being a straight survival mode where you collect medals and healing items, its more of a conquest type thing  where taking on one hexagonal challenge opens up more and it keeps branching out as you colelct medals to buy items and upgrades for your character. Mission Mode also makes a comeback, but instead of just being a fight with certain conditions attached to it like "Only the 5th hit in a combo and above deal damage" it just puts you in a situation and asks a task of you that you have to succeed at more times than you fail.

Of course there is the online aspect of the game. I haven't been able to get into any ranked matches unfortunately but player matches have worked wonderfully. The lobbies try to replice an arcade environment, having up to 4 boths where players can fight and spectate at. Ther weird thing i syou have to pick your character before you confirm the fight with the other person, which is weird, but not too bad. Ive only noticed a bit of latency and lag when a lot of people are coming and going from the lobby at once, otherwise its been a very steady experience, especially with friends.



The Port:

Game runs absolutely great and looks gorgeous. Haven't had much trouble online with the randoms I played, a little bit of latency here and there as people came and left the lobby but nothing bad. When playing with a few friends in a single lobby, it was perfectly fine with no hiccups.

Points taken off I guess for some of the UI being a lowres, not that I reall care about that. Also some people report the FPS taking a nosedive after a long session due to memory leaks, most notably on AMD products. I myself use a 6850 and fx-6130 and have had no issues regarding that. I played about 3 hours straight online with friends while recording the game at 60fps and still had no issues. And the final thing to note is that trying to configure the keyboard controls are a pain in the butt. I use a stick but my friend uses keyboard and he has trouble configuring the arrow keys for movement instead of wasd.

There is an ongoing argument about whether this is a  PS3 port or a PS4 port, but I honestly don't think it matters. it has all the same content and really only a few UI elements are noticeably different upon being pointen out, though ASW and Shini on twitter did say patches are to come. Otherwise the game itself, characters, stages, effects, etc, look completley on par with PS4 and in some situations better in comparison screenshots, and thats before any sort of downsampling or any sort of texture filtering through Gedosato.

Considering how well optimized it is and having all the content of the PS3 and PS4 version, save one superfluous overworld lobby system everyone hates, I think it definitely gets a solid 8, even in the face of the previously mentioned issues. Its an above average port and way better than I had anticipated from ASW.



Overall:

The game itself is amazing and marked the return of Guilty Gear as a major player in the Fighting Game Community and the port itself is very solid. I have a very midrange, soon to be outdated, computer but it handles the game perfectly fine at max settings and at my monitors resolution. The online has been a solid experience so far as well. There are a few issues with the port that will hopefully be ironed out as mentioned above, but otherwise its hard to get better than this. For the discounted $24 with free DLC or even the full $30, I heavily urge you to try it out.

19608812.review:
Strongly, strongly recommend this game after the multiplayer input bug gets fixed. Spent extensive time with this game on PS4.

Easily my favorite current-gen fighting game.

The Good:

Gorgeous graphics, incredibly fluid movement, mechanical depth, and good character playstyle variety.

Beautiful 2D sprite aesthetic (despite using 3D models).

Gameplay: Fun neutral game. Good input buffering for combos. No touch of death bullshit like MvC. Combos aren't boringly long like in Skullgirls/MvC. Less awful input correction than SF4.

The Bad:

Bug: game client starts getting frame lag and sound stuttering after about half an hour of multiplayer. Doesn't affect everyone, though. May want to wait for this to get fixed.
UI Oversight: Using 720p assets for the in-game menus, instead of 1080. Makes the least important section of the game look grainy, but it's still sloppy.

Both issues are specific to the PC port. The PS4 version didn't have them.

I played the PS3 version extensively. This is version is even better (probably a port from the arcade), currently with all DLCs offered: characters, colors and system voices. First lets talk about the graphics in this game, they are 3D with an anime style similar to the popular series Abunai sisters, but the design in Guilty Gear Xrd puts their own twist on this by making it not a pile of shit to look at, I love the look of this game and I can't help but when a KO in this game happens but put a screen shot of the lovely camera angles that show. 

I heard that the only reason that they changed the graphics to 3d was to have a alway availible goto model now to save on the budget on sprite development and never have to worry about them showing age for a long time, but if them making great looking anime styled models with lovely backgrounds is them trying to save the budget I want to see what they can do when they're spending it all. 

Makes me wish there was a mod to move the camera in battle behind you, I wouldn't even care how much harder it would make the game I just want to see it and take more screen shots of this gorgeous game. 

In my opionion the game is really fun, cast is very varied in what every character is capible of and what they use to get the job done and it can also be said that fighting no 2 players is the same since everyone seems to find something else great about the character to use, just when you think you've got that characters play style down. 

From the Roman canceling, rejects, faultless blocking and even more it seems like there is way to much content to get used to at the start but online there are always beginner servers to get a hand in with playing others who are not yet themselves that good at the game.

For a first fighter this could seem a bit like too much but it's really not a bad choise because it means if you're into learning a game inside and out it would be a like being a kid in a candy shop

Now to get to some of the negitives of this game.

The story mode really is just talking the whole time with not a ounce of game play in it and the animation for such lovely 3d modles doesn't due much justice, it's like seeing static VN portraits in 3D and this really shows as an issue when you see fights in story mode look like they're played through micro soft power point.

Next is the online in this game, it's functional if that is a thing to call it but you'll constantly be kicked from rooms that claim good connection and then somehow get into that 0 connection room you clicked by mistake, also the online matches after the patch in this game have lead to a few times the game just crashes.

The patch claims to have fixed the ranked mode in this game but it turned into the same click their name until the game gives up and lets you play that it was before, combined that with the crashing now online and I don't even want to play ranked from fear of being called a rage quitter. 

Then we get to the main issue that I've have had with the game and how well it runs, going by having task manager in the side while running the game to check on it I seen that the specs post patch from pre patch are a good 150% higher and it didn't fix the issue where as the game is running the specs of the game slowly but constantly go up leading to eventual lag on the menu of all things, but here just opening and closing the game seems to reset it.

this is something I really want arksys to get into fixing because the game seems like otherwise it would be able to run really well on much weaker machines.  

It may look like I dragged way much longer on the negitives then the possitives here but when you get past the problems that come mainly in the online and the story mode of the game what you will find is a great fighting game that if you are a fan of the genre you will not want to miss by miles.

Over all the possitives of having a great and closer to the current version of the game come out on PC overlap the negitives but in the future I hope they at least figure how tofix the current online.

>Problems of the port
*memory leak (need to restart client after a few hours, as soon as FPS go below 59.9/60)
*low res HUD (already DIY fixed by manipulating ini-file)
*you can not see full lobbies, which makes the game appear dead
*Region locked (Russia isnt part of Europe, Russian rooms therefore arent shown to Europeans)

>Potential problems of the port
*as soon as the room creator starts lagging due to the above mentioned memory leak, the entire room does (just a theory on my part)
*memory leak might have impact on frame delay (people who should have ~2f in very few cases have 5f+ delay)

>Upsides of the port
*game looks gorgeous in 4K down-sampled (infinitely better than the PS4 version)
*easy arcade controller support from what I have heard and experienced
*room- instead of the PSN's lobby system
*DLC automatically included
*chatting isnt an utter chore (certainly is when playing on PSN)
*net code on par with the PS4 version, maybe better (hard to say due to bugs)
*dirt cheap for what you get
*great optimization and by manipulating the game files this game runs on any toaster of your choice

19605666.review:
Hey you.

Do you like games?
Do you like weird games?
Do you like fighting games?

Then why haven't you bought this yet?

This game is one of the best fighters i have ever played. 

If you're new to Fighting Games i really recommend this to get into, the basic mechanics isn't too hard for a newcomer to pick up and understand. It got the basics, 4 different kind of attacks, a Dust attack where you basically swing people up into the air for aerial combos. 

Sure you can go deeper into the mechanics and do some crazy combos into a instant kill move, but those require a lot of time and practice.

I started playing this game with some friends when it was released for PS4 and i was in love instantly and i was sitting at my computer, looking at steam and wondering why it wasn't released here since X2 and Accent Core is released here, but finally it's here and it's better then ever.

Take everything that have been released for the console version like DLC characters and colors.... And you have that here. 

My god i can't even begin to talk about why this game is so amazing.

This far i can list up a couple of things.

-Easy to get into
-You can find easy BnB combos quite easily
-The Port is freaking amazing, it runs at a steadily 60 fps without any problems.
-Lesser graphics means that basically a stone can run this game WHICH IS GOOD
-Since it's on PC it's easy to just plug in your favourite controller and beat people up.
-Really good rooster, altough i'm a bit sad that older characters like Baiken and Bridget isn't in this one.
-Really good netcode, played a couple of games against different people and it runs amazingly good. 

Why are you still reading this? Buy this game now! In Arc System we believe, thank you guys for finally bringing this masterpiece to PC.

19605312.review:
Gulty Gear Xrd é um port da versão arcade do jogo (e não a versão PS3 como andam dizendo), e como tal, tem alguns inconvenientes como a interface em 720p e uma péssima compressão dos vídeos, que são muito pixelados. O jogo roda numa resolução alta, 1080p, mas não passa disso (não sem editar algum arquivo ini do jogo)

O port é bem feito, afinal é feito na Unreal Engine 3 e a versão arcade é um PC, então seria praticamente impossível errarem no desempenho do jogo.

A inteface não está adaptada para os controles de Xbox 360 e XONE, então é chato você ver para apertar enter ou Esc nos menus. nos controles está correto, mas o Layout do controle padrão é totalmente risível, com B para taunt e RB para Slash.

O jogo é graficamente bom mas principalmente ESPETACULAR artisticamente, tendo a sensação de estar assistindo um anime durante as cutscenes. A movimentação e interação dos personagens é espetácular.

Dublagem e trilha sonora são de altíssimo nível como sempre, como disse acima, é como ver um anime.

A jogabilidade é muito boa, os comandos respondem bem, mas senti falta de alguns elementos dos jogos antigos, que eu não vou citar, pois não tenho certeza se foram removidos ou só modificados.

Existem os modos história e arcade, que por um acaso se complementam, o que é uma excelente jogada da Arc System Works.

Super recomendado, É guilty Gear, o que por si só já seria obrigatório, mas esse jogo é especialmente bem feito, então compre enquanto está na promoção, está barato demais pelo nível de qualidade do jogo!

GUILTY GEAR Xrd -SIGN- est le genre de jeux de combat falice à apréhender, mais compliqué a maitriser !
Les développeurs ont utilisés le moteur Unreal Engine 4 pour faire un lifting complet du jeu en 3D, avec un effet 2D-Animé qui marche du feu de dieu, qui permettent attaques spéciales mises en scènes untra classe !
Les musiques metal sonnent juste dans le jeu, et la possibilité de changer avec les voix japs sont un plaisir ! (à noter que le jeu est en anglais niveau texte)

Pour moins de 30€, GUILTY GEAR Xrd -SIGN- offre un jeu de versus-fighting ultra complet avec un monde histoire, arcade et pleins de défis pour maitriser les personnages.
En plus de ça, le netcode du multijoeur est nikel.
A prendre de suite !

Гилти Гир пришёл на ПК! Да здравствует Гилти Гир. Несмотря на то,что буквально полгода назад потратил около 3 тысяч на Американскую версию для ПС3,не мог пройти мимо. Начать следует с того,что у истинного Пекаря слово "файтинг" ассоциируется прежде всего с серией Гилти Гир,в особенности XXRELOAD. Xrd вышел год назад экслюзивно для консолей от Сони. Что же мы получили? Аниме на движке Unreal. Серьезно,игра выглядит очень красиво. Каждый приём детально прорисован,чего уже говорить об эффектах. В игре имеется огромный функционал. Не понимаете механику? Тут есть полноценный туториал,который обьясняет все тонкости игрового процесса. Хотите освоить определенного персонажа? Есть режим "Challenge" с выполнением различных комб. Хотите вникнуть в историю серии? Стори мод есть,который нужно смотреть как фулл аниме(перед ним рекомендуется пройти аркаду за всех персонажей,чтобы понять некоторые мелочи). Хотите что-то необычное? Режим М.О.М. для вас. Ну и ,разумеется, онлайн режим с лобби,что ещё нужно для счастья. Конечно же, саундтрек от Дайсукэ Исиватари,благодаря которому я обожаю ОСТы данной серии.
Цена вопроса - 400 рублей. 3 тысячи ушло на американку на ПС3 с одним ДЛС персонажем. Здесь же дают ВСЕХ персонажей и ВСЕ палитры цветов для этих персонажей. +Вокал коллекшон,который 10/10. И,несомненно,экслюзив, ПОЛНОЦЕННЫЙ ТРЕК ИЗ ЕЩЁ НЕВЫШЕДШЕГО Revelator'а.
Есть ли в игре минусы? Кто-то сочтёт персонажей несбалансированными.
Для меня же,минусом является персонаж Эльфельт,которая обладает прелестями для среднестатистических японских задротов. Извините.
Итог: Гилти Гир рвёт шаблон и заряжает энергией на целый день,а большего и не нужно. 
HEAVEN OR HELL. LET'S ROCK! 9.5/10

19600283.review:
Finalmente um port decente de um jogo decente de luta para PC. 

Aqui está funcionando normal em 1920x1080 à 60 FPS (tirando uns problemas com os objetos de menu e da tela, exemplo: durante o combate, barra de Tension, o nome "Tension" parece ter uma qualidade bem baixa; pessoal comenta devido a HUD ser uma upscale de 720p, mas nada que atrapalhe o jogo).

A trilha sonora do jogo é ótima, o que já era esperado de um jogo de Guilty Gear.

Para o pessoal mais novo em jogos de luta, o modo training desse jogo faz um bom trabalho em explicar as nuâncias do jogo e há o modo Challenge para aprender as nuâncias de um personagem em específico.

Uso um controle original de XBox 360 com fio e o jogo o reconhece perfeitamente, adaptando os comandos mostrados na tela com os botões do controle de XBox. Faz o mesmo para os botões de teclado, mas não o recomendo para um jogo desse tipo.

Ainda não joguei online para ver como o netcode está, então não posso falar muito sobre isso.

Resumindo: O jogo está ótimo e por R$44,79, melhor ainda (creio que está custando $30 para os norte-americanos), então aproveitem. Na compra do jogo você recebe também uma cópia digital da GUILTY GEAR VOCAL COLLECTION e o ost é ótimo.

Especificações do meu PC para quem tiver interessado em saber no que eu estou rodando:
-AMD FX-8350 4.0Ghz Octa Core
-MSI Radeon R9 380 Gaming 4GB
-Memória 8GB DDR 3 1600 MHz

19600220.review:
길티기어를 하기위해 PS4를 구매했었는데, 이렇게 스팀버전으로 나와주니 감개무량합니다.

결국 이러저러한 자금난으로 PS4를 팔았지만, 후속작이 나오면 중고로라도 사야지 했는데

이렇게 스팀으로 한글판을...게다가 모든 DLC를 포함하고도 3만5천원도 안되는 혜자로움에 저는 감동했습니다.

전반적으로 아크시스템웍스 게임은 타 격투게임 보다 진입장벽은 높지만

굳이 미친듯이 파고들려고 하지않아도, 이래저래 즐기다보면 어느정도는 하게되는것 같습니다.

These are not sprites, they are 3D models running in the Unreal engine, yet most of the time it plays like any other 2D Guilty Gear. GUILTY GEAR Xrd終於上STEAM啦~以3D化風格重新出發的GG系列依然有著強烈日式動漫風格的人物設計和搖滾風格的配樂，配上快節奏的戰鬥方式讓人玩起來熱血激昂，，而且完全中文化讓你從教學模式到故事模式都能看得懂

圖像方面這次是採用3D的關係，所以不會像前作的GG或是BB系列會有解析度破壞2D圖像的情況出現，這個大缺點改善後遊戲體驗不會再被破壞了:P

19597211.review:
It's the same great game as it is on consoles, with better graphics in-game, and some welcome changes for a PC port. The lack of in-depth options is dissapointing, and the game has quite a few minor issues that hurt this port. That being said, this port has fantastic netcode! I had 2F delay to somebody in Seattle! That's insane if you consider the before this I've only ever had 2F to a person living near me. For that reason alone, this PC port is a big step up for Arc System Works. It's not rollback, but it's pretty damn good. I recommend this game to anybody interested in fighting games (so long as you don't gush over Elphelt :^) )

I'll now list the issues I've discovered.

[list]
    [*]You can not change your resolution in full screen mode. Full screen is a seperate resolution option.
    [*]The games UI is from the PS3 port. The in game graphics are not, and neither is the hud. Unfortunately, this makes the menus look awful when upscaled to 1080p. They don't look very good at 720p either.
    [*]Anti-aliasing seems to have no effect. I can clearly see jaggy lines no matter which option I set my AA to.
    [*]There are no (obviously) usable configs within the games files. I can not change the settings to optimize it's performance on my system. (This is somewhat alleviated now thanks to a community guide showing me how to downsample from 4K resolution. Game looks pretty great and runs well.)
    [*]The game seems to be having memory issues for me. If I play the game for quite a while, the framerate will slow down between 30-50 and run extremely poorly. 
    [*]The music may be of slightly lower quality than the music in the PS4 version. As well as this, the character attack sounds are kind of bad. Especially on Axl, I hear awful audio crackle. It's very obnoxious.
    [*]Player matches are very buggy at the moment, if a lot is going in in public lobbies there seem to be many issues causing players to vanish, be fighting no opponent, or just get kicked out of the lobby. It's a little tricky to play online right now. Ranked matches aren't fairing too well either, I can't play ranked right now due to a bug. The game will claim they declined the match almost instantly, but this happens with all players in ranked mode right now.

This issues aren't the end of the world, but I'm sure we'd all appreciate it if these problems were fixed.

Also, Elphelt should be removed from the game. Not really, but she just doesn't fit in with the cast if you ask me. Who won a competition to get their waifu OC in the game?

罪恶装备可以说是格斗游戏早期动作最华丽的游戏之一，最早引入了一击必杀的技能，出色的人物造型和游戏音乐可以说是格斗游戏中的顶峰之作。
画面上这部无可挑剔，人物画风变得太厉害玩过前几部的表示难以适应，人物的登场的特写是现在3D格斗游戏中很常见的一种方式，每个技能动画也是做得很精致，击杀特写都给你360度视角来个特写。相比同作品苍翼默示录连续变换来说，画面感觉还是比不上，但是华丽程度已经大大超越了。剧情动画方面也是相当不错，即时演算动画的过场让人想起真人快打系列的高大上感觉。
音乐方面做得很不错，不过感觉有些吵，难度方面...虽然我玩过很多格斗游戏，不知道是本身技术问题啥的，开了最难AI打起来感觉没什么压力，罪恶装备和苍翼默示录一样都有EX角色，在所有格斗游戏中这是极不平衡的存在。
说起游戏平衡，历代罪恶都有一击必杀的招式，一不小心就能翻盘，挑战模式是极不平衡的，新手玩家慎入。

19596189.review:
XRD is an amazing fighting game, one of the best; and now it's on PC. 

Guilty Gear is a game where there are a lot of system mechanics, along with some really unique character designs. The strong universal defensive system mechanics along with the way the tension/super meter works creates an exhilerating, fast paced game with a strong focus on offense and momentum. 

The PC port runs perfectly fine, with some anti aliasing and the "standard" resolution options including widescreen. The options menu is kinda sparse, but because it's an unreal game you can do a lot of ini editting to really lower the graphics if needed.

The netplay is delay based, and having the PS3 version of the game, the PC version is as good if not slightly better. (This might be because 99% of PCs are on wired internet, as opposed to PS3s) Ranked Mode suffers more lag then the player match rooms. Although unfortunate they didn't fix it, this was an issue on the consoles as well.

While I don't have the most controller options, it instantly detected my Qanba Q4 and my xbox one controller, as well as having more then enough keyboard support. If you don't plug it in before you start the game, there might be trouble though.

The worst thing I can say about GG is that it has a steep learning curve, even by fighting game standards. However, with the tutorial, challenge, and mission modes, it makes jumping in blind not as daunting, the only fighting game that does the tutorialization better would be Skullgirls, and even then this is very close if not equal. That being said, this game is good enough that I urge you to look at some gameplay of it, and try to dive right in.

Also, for the first month all of the DLC is free, including the colors that were exclusive to PS+ on console. Even after the first month; as opposed to the console version where just Sin was avaliable with your ingame fight money, all 3 of the DLC characters are obtainable with it. (Sin, Elphelt, and Leo)

Theres a reason why this game is only half-jokingly referred to as God's Gift.

Praise be.

P.S. If you're interested in learning more about the game in depth, Dustloop is the main community for Guilty Gear and other Arc Systerm fighters. Theres also some surprisingly good content already being posted on the steam guides section.

19595563.review:
First off I just want to say that ASW really knocked it out of the park with this port. Game looks fantastic and plays great online.

One thing that I'm amazed at is how awesome the training mode is for this game. They really teach you the VERY basics of how to go about playing this game. It's something that will ease beginning players in without having them feel overwhelmed by everything right from the get go. From there you've got a mode that teaches you combos and another mode that puts you in typical situations that you'll find yourself in from time to time while playing against opponents. Along with the is a very fleshed out freestyle training mode that they been offering us since 1998.

Online play seems pretty smooth right off the bat, although there are some who seem to be having issues with lobbies at the moment. Aside from that, playing in game is smooth. If there was lag then I'm oblivious to it. The few matches that I had so far felt great... Aside from me getting stomped into oblivion. 

While some people will scoff at the number of characters in this game, I see nothing wrong with it as you can see ASW seems to have gone with quality before quantity. Every character has been animated in a way to replicate the animation frames from the older games. It's a joy just to sit back and just watch the characters, attacks, specials, instant kills, and intros/outros. 

I haven't had the chance to try out Story, Arcade, or any other of the modes so far due to trying to learn Ramlethal at the moment, But as soon as I do, I'll make sure to update this review.  But from what I've experienced you shouldn't even hesitate at spending your hard earned money on this. It even comes with a slew of goodies. Including an awesome soundtrack.

19595529.review:
the game is a lot of fun, and this seems like a fairly decent port.  the models themselves are very clean and there's no issues from what i can tell with the shaders or whatever.  functionally it is the same as the console release.  price seems reasonable with all the dlc included for an older game like this. netplay seems better than the console when it works, but that's almost certianly because less people are on wifi.  overall, probably worth your money if you're interested in xrd on pc.

couple gripes though:
ui is really ugly because it's upscaled from what are presumably ps3 assets.
there are no "regional lobbies" but they were kinda weird in the console release anyway.  
there are some issues with the lobbies themselves crashing or not letting people in, so it might be a good idea to wait until that's ironed out. 
when the game isn't running at 60 on both sides, it seems to crank up the delay during netplay to compensate.  this isn't exactly surprising though.

19595125.review:
The in-game performance is perfect. It's the issues that are other than gameplay that prevents me from recommending this game to other people.

I don't understand why, but a lot of Japanese games that have been ported from the consoles, seem to neglect the fact that every gamer has his/her own preference in key mapping when using a keyboard as a main gear. This is a huge disappointment and in a sense, truly mindless. I don't know what the publishers have learned from all the complaints they received when Acana Heart 3 was just released on steam. THIS HAS TO BE FIXED. Also, I do not know whether it is a bug or not, but when I re-bind the keys, I cannot use the same keys for in-game and menu. For instance, when I bind the direction keys to 'I, J, K, L', I can move my character in the game, but have to use 'WASD' again in the menu. The menu screen simply forces me to used the keys that have been binded by the game.

Menu UI and Character select screen shows that it is not native 1080p. Although this is not something that directly influences the gameplay, it still is a disappointment nonetheless. But this can be overlooked because it is relatively small matter compared to key-binding/functioning problem.

As much as I love this series, I'm depressed at the current state of this game. Turn on the PC version of 'Ultra Street Fighter 4' that was released some time ago, and go through everything in the Options menu. You will be surprised to see a game that had its prime some time ago with uncomparable quality in options.

I can't believe it either. Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN- is on Steam!

Game looks great. One of the most beatiful looking not only fighting but all games in my opinion. And it runs 50-60 fps on my almost 4 year old laptop. Sure it will run smoothly on most PCs 
Audio is great, you can switch between Japanese and English. BGMs all just as always perfect (you also can unlock BGMs from Guilty Gear XX-2!) if you ever played Guilty Gear or BlazBlue you won't be disappointed.
Gameplay wise it is one of the best fighting games today. It's harder to master than Mortal Kombat or Street Fighter, but in-game tutorial is decent and you have various challenges apart arcade mode to train your skills.

19594855.review:
When I heard the news that Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN- was coming to PC, I was a bit skeptical. I am a huge fan of fighting games and didn't want this to be a horrific port. ArcSys dashed out ALL doubts I had. While I can't yet speak for the online portion of the game, the offline / single-player experience is as smooth as can be. 

For $24 (as of this review), you get the full game (obviously), but you also recieve ALL DLC for no additional charge (at least that's how it was for me :p). This includes 3 additional characters, all costume colors, and all system voices to change the announcer voice to that of your favorite character! The game also has MAGNIFICENT art style (in my honest opinion of course). The game's music is also fantastic (and as a side note, the creator of the game is also the composer for all the music. How cool is that?!). 

The only "con" I have is that when you play the tutorial or challenge mode, the onscreen inputs change from the keyboard's keys to the Xbox buttons every couple of seconds (if you're using a controller / fightstick). But this is a simple fix as the game has an option to switch the input display from the Xbox / keyboard buttons to the abbrieviations of the attacks as they are called in the game.

So even though this review isn't really an in-depth one, I can honestly say I recommend this game to anyone looking for an anime game, (or in my case) a new fighting game to play. 10/10

****EDIT****
After looking up information about the PC release, I have now found out why I have access to all of the DLC. For the first week of this game being on the steam store, you will get ALL the DLC for no extra charge.

19594540.review:
I already own this game on PS3 where the base game was $30 on sale and I had to buy all the extra content which came out to be about $60 total. If it was a 1:1 copy of the ps3 I would already say this is a steal. 

Gameplay:I feel that the game might not be as refined as streetfighter but amongst the anime figther sub-genre GGxrd should be the mold used from now on. The controls are fluid, the action is fast and the specials have that cinematic punch which makes them feel amazing when well executed. Even for a casual player like me the gameplay is challenging yet enjoyable. Unlockables aren't content blocks yet rather minor avatar cosmetics or sounds (aside from the unlockable characters which are already unlocked as of now).

Graphics: Old sprite based games look like poop when upscaled to 1440p and above. Even modern 2d sprite based fighters aspire for the 720p-1080p range. This game looks great at any resolution and it runs SMOOTH on older hardware (60 fps easily). Somehow they got the game to almost always have that distinct anime look without the jaring animation transitions which many cartoon graphics games have. 

Price: The game just came out on PC even though its been out for over a year on console. Many publishers would market their game at $60 because its new to the platform regardless of when it originally came out. The $30 price tag is extremely fair for getting the game and all the DLC content that consoles have. 

Conclusion: Arc System Works is starting to become one of my favorite game developers. Now that they publish their own games on PC we are getting high quality releases with full content at reasonable prices while the game is still relevant. I'm hoping they look to further break the trend of price gouging on fighters by releasing the next installment, -Revalator-, for a discounted price for owners of GGXrd -Sign-.
